loans.name: Porfiria

texts.es:
La señora Porfiria es socia del Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru I” desde hace 4 meses atrás, del distrito  y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 39 años de edad, cuenta con estudios primarios incompletos, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. 
Porfiria se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles comprò de redes, corchos, etc.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con los que podrá comprar una vaca.
Su sueño para el futuro es comprarse su carro y que sus hijos sean profesionales. 
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Porfiria has been a member of the "Tupac Amary I" Community Bank for the last 4 months in the Yunguyo province, district of Puno. She is 39 years old, has an incomplete primary education, and is married with three children. Porfiria buys and sells fish, and she tells us that with her first loan through the Movimiento Manuela Ramos of 500 soles she bought nets, bobbers, etc. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles so she can buy a cow. Her dreams for the future are to buy herself a cart and that her children become professionals. What she likes the best about her Community Bank is the meetings among the members.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Darwin Antonio

texts.es:
En el municipio de Condega del departamento de Estelí, el señor Darwin P. con gran ahínco se ha destacado en la venta de alimentos y bebidas siendo su especialidad en la venta los pollos al pastor que con mucho esfuerzo prepara para ofrecerlos en su localidad.

Actualmente tiene el reto de mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y para ello ha iniciado a reconstruir su localidad para tener un local más amplio, seguro y que preste las condiciones necesarias para que los clientes se sientan satisfechos. Por esta razón es que solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción que le permitan continuar con el mejoramiento del local para brindar excelentes condiciones en su negocio de venta de pollos al pastor.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Condega in the Estelí district, Mr. Darwin P., with great earnestness, has dedicated himself to the sale of food and drinks. He has specialized in the sale of chicken “al pastor” (Shwarma-style spit-grilled meat), which he works hard to cook and offer to his community. Currently, he has the desire to improve his business's conditions, so he has started to reconstruct his locale in order to make his space larger and safer, and to be able to provide the necessary conditions for his clients to feel comfortable. For this reason, he is seeking a loan to buy the construction materials that would allow him to continue improving his space to offer excellent conditions in his chicken “al pastor” business.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara T. es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 65 años, es viuda y madre de tres hijos mayores de edad.
Sara se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir para lo cual cuenta con un pequeño taller de costura en su casa. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace tres años y el primer crédito que recibió fue 300.00 nuevos soles los que utilizó en la compra de productos como hilos, blondas, etc. 
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà telas y a la vez repararà su máquina de coser. 
La meta de Sara es llegar a tener un taller de costura bien implementado.
texts.en:
Sara T. is a hard-working and dynamic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region. She is 65 years old, a widow, and the mother of three grown children.

Sara sews various articles of clothing in a small sewing workshop in her house. She has been a member of the community bank Madres Corajes (Women of Spirit) for three years. The first loan she received was for 300 PEN, which she used to by fabrics, lace, etc. At the present time, she needs a loan of 500 PEN, with which she will buy fabrics and at the same time repair her sewing machine. Sara's goal is to have a well-equipped sewing workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy fabric and maintain her sewing machine

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Felix H. se ha destacado por vender carne la cual la mantiene almacenada en una mantenedora y a la espera de que sus clientes le visiten para comprar la carne en su establecimiento en el municipio de Condega.

El negocio lo tiene desde hace 10 años habiendo ofrecido tanto carne de res como de  cerdo. La razón por la que ha solicitado el crédito es para la compra de la carne con el fin de continuar comercializándola en su local de tal manera que le continúe generando ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar que tiene a su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Felix H.'s business is the sale of meat, which he stores in a refrigerator and his clients come to see him to buy the meat in his establishment in the municipality of Condega. He has had this business for ten years, and offers his clients both beef and pork. The reason why he is seeking this loan is to buy more meat in order to continue selling it in his store. This way, he can continue generating revenue, which he uses to fulfill his responsibility of maintaining his household.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat

loans.name: Roeli

texts.es:
Roeli es una mujer dinámica, vive en el distrito de Campo Verde, región de Ucayali. ElL. tiene 43 años y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es agricultor.
Roeli se dedica a L. confección de prendas de vestir y paralelamente a L. venta de gaseosas, actividad que realiza desde su casa.
ElL. integra el Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace nueve años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles que utilizò en L. compra de una máquina de coser.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 3000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà sacos de yuca que posteriormente venderà en L. ciudad de Arequipa. 
L. meta de Roelia es tener una fuente de soda en su casa.
texts.en:
Roeli is a dynamic woman who lives in the Campo Verde district in the Ucayali region. She is 43 years old and counts on the support of her husband, who is a farmer.

Roeli makes clothing and, in parallel, sells sodas; she carries out both activities from her home. She joined the community bank "Las Nazarenas" nine years ago, and the first credit she received was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy a sewing machine. Now she needs a loan of 3000 PEN, with which she will buy bags of yucca that she will then sell in the city of Arequipa. Roeli's goal is to have a soda fountain in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of yucca to sell in the city of Arequipa

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.en:
For six years Jose has had a pulpería, a small general store operated out of the front of his house. He sells things like rice, beans, sugar and other products that are regularly consumed in a household. He began this business with financing, purchasing merchandise for his inventory which allowed him to start the store.  With his earnings he was able to build up his inventory and now he has a good inventory and both his business and his income continue to grow. 

Jose’s aspirations are to be more economically stable and to finish his higher education. He says that the economic crisis has resulted in high prices and it has generally had a bad effect on people.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli” desde hace 1 años atrás (reingresante), del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 32 años de edad, cuenta con estudios secundarios completos, es casada y tiene 3 hijos.
Lourdes se dedica a la venta de artesanìa y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles compró los materiales necesarios para la elaboraciòn de las artesanías.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con los que podrá comprar lana y bayeta.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su tienda de artesanías y que sus hijos sean profesionales. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Señora Lourdes has been a member of the community bank "Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli" since she rejoined a year ago. The bank is located in the Juli district of the Chucuito province in the department of Puno. She is 32 years old and completed secondary school. She is married and has three children.

Lourdes sells handicrafts. She tells us that with her first loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 500 PEN, she bought materials needed to make handicrafts. She is applying for a loan of 500 PEN with which she will buy wool and felt.

Her dream for the future is to have her handicrafts shop and for her children to have careers. Her favorite thing about the community bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool and felt

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Nuestro socio MARTIN tiene 48 años, es viudo, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL” de la Asociación Arariwa. El tiene cuatro hijos, tres son independientes y la menor Jasmira tiene 15 años y estudia en el colegio.        
 
El socio es empleado de la Universidad Nacional de San Antonio Abad del Cusco en la unidad de trámite documentario de patrimonio. Ya son 32 años con el trabajo y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su labor y tiene un carro que alquila para dar servicio de transportes en la ciudad. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para implementar el carro comprando accesorios nuevos.         
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our client MARTIN is 48 years old, a widower, and a native of Cuzco City. He belongs to the communal bank “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL” of Asociación Arariwa. He has four children, three grown up and independent, and the youngest, Jasmira, is 15 years old and is in high school. He is an employee of the National Unversity “San Antonio Abad del Cusco” in the financial documentation department. He has been doing this job for 32 years, and it has served him very well thanks to the effort he has devoted to his work. He also has a car that he rents as a transportation service in the city. He is a father, a hard-working and entrepreneurial person, who has been able to help his family prosper. He needs this loan to improve his car by buying new accessories. He is grateful for the opportunity offered to her through these means and therefore she promises to make all her payments according to her time line.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He needs this loan to improve his car by buying new accessories.

loans.name: Lupita Iris

texts.es:
Lupita es una mujer dinámica y muy trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Campo Verde, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 27 años y es madre de tres hijos menores de edad.
Lupita se dedica a la venta de frutas de la región al por mayor junto a su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace ocho meses y el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300.00 nuevos soles que invirtió en la compra de limones para vender en el mercado de Bellavista de la ciudad de Pucallpa.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà productos de abarrotes para vender desde su casa. 
La meta de Lupita es llegar a tener un Minimarket y mejorar la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
Lupita is a dynamic and hard-working woman. She lives in the Campo Verde district of the Ucayali region. She is 27 years old and is the mother of three minor children. Lupita and her husband sell local fruits wholesale. She has been a member of the community bank "Las Nazarena" for eight months. The first loan she obtained was for 300 PEN, which she invested in the purchase of lemons to sell in the Bellavista market in the city of Pucallpa. Now she is applying for a loan of 500 PEN with which she will buy grocery products to sell from her house. Lupita's goal is to have a minimarket and to improve the economy of her household.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery stock

loans.name: Oscar Enrique

texts.en: Oscar has a small store, called a pulpería, that he operates out of the front of his house. Oscar has three children.  About five years ago when his wife was pregnant with their second child she was too ill to continue her work as a housekeeper, so they decided to open a small store that she could run while maintaining her health and safety. Oscar dreams of being able to improve his house and of helping his children get ahead. Oscar and his family have greatly benefited from the loans that he has received: Oscar says that he would not have been able to manage the repayments without the support of his wife.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa P. con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su negocio de salón de belleza el que posee en el departamento de Estelí específicamente en el municipio de Condega donde a diario ofrece su servicio estando abierto el establecimiento desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta por las noches.

Luego que ella sale del bachillerato, tenía la vocación de ser estilista y estudió varios cursos hasta llegar a poner su propio negocio el que ha mantenido desde entonces ya que ella es una de los primeras estilista de este Municipio lo que le favorece en tener su propia clientela

Realiza cortes de cabello a todas las personas, así como  peinados, tintes de cabello, etc. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de los productos de belleza como son peines, gelatinas, tintes, cremas, entre otros productos que le ayudaran a mejorar las condiciones de su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa P. works hard at improving her beauty salon, which is located in the town of Condega in the department of Estelí. She offers her services every day and is open from early in the morning until nightfall.

After completing high school, Rosa chose to become a stylist as her vocation and took different courses until she could establish her own business. Being one of the first stylists in the city gave her an advantage in building up her clientele.

Rosa provides haircuts to everyone, as well as other services such as styling, coloring, etc. This loan will be used to purchase beauty products and supplies such as combs, gels, dyes, creams, and other items that will help improve the condition of her beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products & supplies

loans.name: Danixa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia DANIXA tiene 35 años, es conviviente, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL” de la Asociación Arariwa. La socia tiene dos hijos: Álvaro tiene 13 años y Renzo tiene 9 años ambos estudian en el colegio “Salesianos” de la ciudad del Cusco.       
 
La socia es profesional en Obstetricia pero se dedico al negocio de agregados de construcción. Ella y su esposo tienen una empresa procesadora de piedra chancada. Ya son seis años con el trabajo y les ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Nuestra socia y su esposo son unos padres, trabajadores y emprendedores que sacan adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para la educación y alimentación de sus hijos. 
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Danixa is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and a native of Cusco. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Emprendedores de San Cristobal”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. Danixa has two children, Álvaro (age 13) and Renzo (age 9). Both are students at the Salesianos School in Cusco.

Danixa is an obstetrician by profession, but she also has a business producing construction aggregates. She and her husband manage a company that processes crushed stone. They have been in operation for six years and have done very well as a result of their hard work and effort. Danixa and her husband are diligent, enterprising parents who want to succeed for the sake of their family. She is requesting a loan to educate and feed her children.

Danixa is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Educate & feed her children

loans.name: Susan

texts.es:
Nuestra socia SUSAN tiene 31 años, es soltera, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL” de la Asociación Arariwa.     
 
La socia y su novio tienen un pequeño negocio de venta de accesorios de computadoras en su domicilio. Ella cuenta que al principio vendió una computadora y ahora vende computadoras portátiles. Ya son varios años con el negocio y les ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Nuestra socia y su novio son unos jóvenes, trabajadores y emprendedores que salen adelante a pesar de las adversidades. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más accesorios de computadoras pues en esta época del año es cuando más se vende.
      
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Susan is 31 years old, single, and a native of Cusco. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Emprendedores de San Cristobal”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

Susan and her boyfriend have a small business selling computer accessories out of her home. She says this business started when she sold a computer, and now she sells laptops. Susan has been in business for a few years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. She and her boyfriend are young hardworking entrepreneurs who have managed to get ahead despite facing adversity. Susan is requesting a loan to buy more computer accessories since her sales increase during this time of the year.

She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computer accessories

loans.name: Sayda

texts.es:
Nuestra socia SAYDA tiene 34 años, es casada, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL” de la Asociación Arariwa.  La socia tiene tres hijos: Andrea tiene 7 años y estudia en el colegio, Adriano tiene 3 años y Marco tiene un año y medio.       
 
La socia es Ingeniero en Zootecnia y tiene un pequeño centro de alimentación de ganado en la ciudad de Paruro. La socia compra animales tiernos de 3 a 5 años de nacidos y los engorda en 45 días y después lo vende al camal. Ya son tres años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales pues en esta época del año es cuando más se vende.
      
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sayda is 34 years old, married, and a native of Cusco. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Emprendedores de San Cristobal”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. Sayda has three children: Andrea (age 7 and a student), Adriano (age 3), and Marco (age 1½).

She is an animal husbandry engineer and has a small cattle feeding center in the city of Paruro. Sayda buys animals that range in age from 3-5 years and fattens them for 45 days before selling them to a slaughterhouse. She has been in this business for three years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. Sayda is a diligent and enterprising mother who manages to get ahead for the sake of her family despite facing adversity. She is requesting a loan to buy more animals since she sells more around this time of the year.

Sayda is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more animals to sell

loans.name: Aunofo

texts.en:
Aunofo is 36 and married with 3 children (ages 3-8).  She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has 5 years of experience in this business.    Aunofo needs a loan of WST $1300 to expand from plantation to vegetable garden.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Aunofo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Aunofo's 3rd loan with SPBD. 

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. 

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to expand from plantation to vegetable garden

loans.name: Faataumamate

texts.en:
Faataumamate is 30 and married with 2 children ((ages 8 months and 1 yr).  She is starting a business venture, planting & harvesting cabbage, tomatoes, and cucumber.    Faataumamate needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Faataumamate joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Faataumamate's 1st loan with SPBD. 

In addition, SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a "3 out of 3" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a "2 out of 3" = secondary/high-school, and a "1 out of 3" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. 

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

Faataumamate's Overall Social Metric Score*:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. 

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Pine

texts.en:
Pine is 56 and married with 6 children (ages 22-37).  She owns & operates a business venture, selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community.  She has 4 years of experience in this business.    Pine needs a loan of WST $1000 to invest in renovating the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2007, Pine joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Pine's 4th loan with SPBD. 

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Gleny Yolanda

texts.es:
Nuestra socia YOLANDA tiene 32 años, es conviviente, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL” de la Asociación Arariwa.  La socia tiene dos hijos: Melani tiene 10 años y estudia en el colegio, Humberto tiene 3 años y esta en el jardín.         
 
La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su tienda de video juegos.  Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades. 
      
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yolanda (32) lives with her partner; she is from the city of Cusco and is a member of the "Emprendedores de San Cristóbal" Community Bank in the Arariwa Association. She has two children: Melani (10) goes to school and Humberto (3) is in kindergarten. Yolanda combines looking after the home with attending to her videogame store.She has been in business for several years and has succeeded through hard work. She is an entrepreneurial working mother who has provided for her family despite adversities. Yolanda is grateful for the opportunity which this loan will provide her, and she undertakes to fulfil the repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her store by buying more videogames and TVs

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Nuestro socio EDGAR tiene 32 años, es conviviente, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL” de la Asociación Arariwa. El tiene dos hijos: Melani tiene 10 años y estudia en el colegio, Humberto tiene 3 años y esta en el jardín.        
 
El socio hace servicio de transportes en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son tres años con el servicio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su labor. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para implementar el carro comprando accesorios nuevos.         
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Edgar (32) lives with his partner; he is from the city of Cusco and is a member of the "Emprendedores de San Cristóbal" Community Bank in the Arariwa Association. He has two children: Melani (10) goes to school and Humberto (3) is in kindergarten. He operates a taxi in the city of Cusco. He has been in business for three years and things are going well as a result of his hard work. He is an entrepreneur who provides for his family. He needs the loan to improve the taxi by purchasing new accessories. He is grateful for the opportunity which this loan will provide him, and he undertakes to fulfil the repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy accessories/parts for his taxi

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia S. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old. Cynthia is widowed and has 5 adult children. Cynthia owns & operates a business providing transport services to community members with her motorcycle. loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
H. Tungalag is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger". Her oldest son, Altangerel, is in college, and her youngest, Nemehbayar, attends a local secondary school. Her husband is a driver and manages a transportation service. Tungalag operates a clothing trading business in her town. She sells a variety of clothing items, most of which she imports from China to her many customers. Tungalag started her business in 2001 with capital of 400,000 tugrugs (~280 USD). After years of successful operations she has managed to increase her working capital to a level exceeding 1,500,000 tugrugs (~1,050 USD) today. Her earnings have enabled her to by a car for her husband to use as a taxi. Tungalag is always looking toward the future and hopes her continued success will allow her to provide for her family. She says, “I want my children to become educated people.” She is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug (~840 USD) loan to purchase clothes from China to sell in her business.

About XacBank:

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
T. Jargalsaihan is 34 years old and lives with his 2-year-old son, Bold-Erdene, in Zavkhan province in western Mongolia. They live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Jargalsiakhan operates a carpet and construction materials business in his town. He opened for business in 2003 as a carpet distributor. He had early success selling carpet and his earnings enabled him to begin selling construction materials. Today, his business continues to grow quickly and he has a strong base of loyal customers. Ever since his wife's death two years ago, Jargalsaikhan has worked hard to manage his business and raise his son. He says, “I must save money to provide my son with a good future.” To continue his success, Jargalsiahan hopes to soon open an electronics and appliance store. He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase electronic items and appliances to start his new business.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
G. Lhagvasuren is 48 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Zavkhan province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her husband is a fireman who also works in construction during the summer. Lhagvasuren operates a vegetable trading business in her town. She sells a variety of vegetables from a rented stall at the local market. Lhagvasuren started her business in 2000 and has built a successful operation over the years. Today, she has a loyal customer base that provides her with a consistent stream of business. Lhagvasuren is very hardworking and is focused on the future. She says, “I am working hard to improve my family's quality of life.” Her wish is to one day have her own grocery shop. Lhagvasuren is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase a small building where she can operate her grocery business.

loans.name: Sharavdorj

texts.en:
S. Sharavdorj is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a house in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His girls, ages 12 and 6, both attend secondary school and his wife is the director at the local tax office. Sharavdorj manages a raw materials trading business in his town. He collects raw materials, such as animal skins and products, from the countryside and transports them to Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia, to sell. Sharavdorj has been in business for 12 years now and has built a consistent operation over the years. He is focused on growing his business and hopes to expand in the near future. He says, “I am working hard to improve my business.” He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase raw materials to sell in his business.

loans.name: Chimgee

texts.en:
Chimgee Z. is a single mother of two children and she currently lives with her youngest child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest son works in South Korea as a contract worker, and he sends money to his mother. His mother recently purchased a new one-bedroom apartment with her son's money. Besides the remittance money she receives, she sells cheap shoes at Sundae Center, a 24-hour shopping mall in the busiest district of Ulaanbaatar. She rents a small stall and sells various men's and women's shoes imported from China. She says that because her stall is located in the busiest section, the business is doing pretty well. She further says that she would like to expand her business by adding more quality shoes in her stall. Her dream is to be financially able to send her youngest daughter to get the best education abroad. She requests a loan to purchase more winter shoes for her business.

loans.name: Zorigt

texts.en:
Zorigt G. lives with his mother in Tuv province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His mother is already retired but helps in his business. Zorigt has been trying different businesses to be successful. He started a business making food with seaweed in 2006; however, it did not go well and he decided to switch to production of baked goods. Today Zorigt makes eight types of baked goods and sells them at various supermarkets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He says that he has finally got the kind of business he was looking for, and aims to expand his business. He plans to hire two bakery specialists and produce more baked goods in order to meet supermarkets' orders. He requests a loan to purchase necessary bakery equipment and ingredients for his business.

loans.name: Davhardavaa

texts.en:
Davhardavaa N. is 49 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Tuv province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His two oldest children are 26 and 24 years old and they both go to universities in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The youngest son is 19-year-old and goes to a local secondary school. Davhardavaa has a small family business retailing coal. He owns a truck that he uses for transporting coal from the mining site to the town. He runs the coal retail business with his wife and his children. Once he brings the coal from the mine, his wife sells it by the bag to local families who use the coal to heat their houses and cook their food. Coal retail is a good business, especially during a cold season like winter, he says. He has been doing this coal retail business since 2004 and been quite successful. He says that he aims to purchase a house for his family with the accumulated earnings from his business. He requests a loan to purchase more coal for his business.

loans.name: Kabowa Group, Jinja

texts.en: W. David is the leader of his lending group in Jinja. He is a hard working, determined and friendly man with a long-time business of buying and selling produce from Kabowa. David also owns a sugarcane plantation where he sells the sugarcanes to traders on wholesale and he is happy that he has a ready market for his produce. He is a married man with school-going children. The savings he makes from his business, in addition to part of his loan, will help him to clear his children’s school fees and family welfare. David needs a loan to help with buying more produce like coffee beans and cassava for resale.

Kaira's life goal is to own a fully stocked shop.  She is married to a soldier and has seven children ranging from four to seventeen years. She describes herself as friendly, generous and social.

loans.name: George Mburu

texts.en:
George is 22 years old and married to Mercy. They have one son aged 4 months.

George learned about KADET through the KADET sign board (marketing). He has no loan or credit history with other micro-finance institutions.

George has been running a greengrocer (fruit and vegetable) business for the past six months. With this loan, he intends to add stock to his business. Specifically, he will purchase bananas and onions to sell to customers, thereby diversifying his stock.

George intends to open a wholesale shop with the extra profits generated from the business as a result of this loan. His dreams are to expand his business and set up a chain of stores (supermarkets). George says he is not afraid to take valuable business risks in the future so long as they are calculated. He describes himself as very hardworking.

loans.use: To add bananas and onions to his business stock

loans.name: Florentina's Group

texts.en:
Florentina B. is from the village of San Jose. She is 49 years old. Florentina is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marcos.

Florentina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Florentina owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Florentina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Florentina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florentina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Florentina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisher folks and small entrepreneurs.

Her dream is to expand her business and create employment for other young Kenyans. Margaret is positive about life and says she does not give up even when things don't go as planned. She says she is very optimistic.

loans.name: Surenjargal

texts.en:
B. Surenjargal is 37 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Zavkhan province in western Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. All four of her children, three sons and a daughter, currently attend a local secondary school and her husband manages a local transportation service. Surenjargal has operated a meat trading business in her town for the last nine years. She provides a variety of locally-raised meats to her many customers. Since starting, Surenjargal has built a stable business and has continually grown her customer base. She hopes to continue her success in the future and says, “ I am working hard to feed my family.” She is requesting a 2,500,000-tugrug loan to purchase meat to sell in her business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en: B. Flavia is a hardworking business woman of thirty-eight years of age. She is blessed with five children. She owns a pub which she has been operating for over five years, that is, since the year 2004. She is using the loan to purchase pub items such as crates of drinks and more. She also provides accommodation services, and she wants to purchase more bed sheets, blankets and so forth. She is a determined business woman whose aim is to open up a motor spare parts shop for more income.

loans.use: To purchase pub items such as crates of drinks, and accomodation items such bed sheets and blankets.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: N. Amina owns a bookshop on Butiaba Road called "Kaboyo Gabriel Bookshop". She is a 28-year-old woman who lives in Butanjwa Village, Hoima district. She has two children but she is not married yet. She started her business nine years ago (that is to say, in the year 2000). She is using this loan to purchase various types of books to meet customers’ demands. She is a hardworking business lady whose future plan is to buy a machine to print exams, scripts and pamphlets. This machine may help her to expand her client base and make her book center a fully fledged one-stop stationery shop.

loans.use: To purchase books for a bookstore

loans.name: Wassila

texts.en:
Wassila has owned a clothing store since 1998. She is a 59-year-old widowed woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her two children. Wassila has competitive prices and is generous with her clients – she always discounts to please them. Her clients are mainly her friends, neighbors and passersby. When she first started her business, she had to face competition from bigger stores; whereas now, she has her own clientele and is always providing the best for her clients. She decided on this business because she wanted to improve her financial situation especially after her husband passed away.

Wassila requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. Wassila has been a microcredit client for 13 years now and has always repaid on time. Her previous loans helped improve her store by diversifying her merchandise and answering more of her clients’ needs. Wassila is very trustworthy and is doing what she does to improve her financial situation and provide the best for her children. In the future, she plans to keep on improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:

Josephine is 45 years old and is married to a peasant. She has seven children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children and build them a permanent house for settlement.

loans.name: Latifat

texts.en:
Latifat, age 37, owns a pharmacy where she sells different kinds of medicines. She has been in this business for over seven years and has been a client with Kiva partner LAPO for three years now. She is a member of LAPO Microfinance. She says her business is moving along well and, with the profit derived from her participation in the program, she is able to support her family’s needs. She appreciates the first loan given to her and she is grateful to all her lenders for their help.

She is asking for a loan in the amount of NGN 150,000 in order to purchase more medicines to sell. She hopes that this loan will help her continue her efforts to build a business that will be profitable and thereby beneficial for her family. Latifat is married and has three children.

She sends a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell at her pharmacy.

He is requesting a loan to pay for seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to cultivate his strawberry crop.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen A., age 39, lives in Yerevan with his wife, two school-aged daughters, and their three-year-old son. Arsen’s wife stays at home to care for the children. Arsen is a cook, but he also has a clothes-trading business. He sells out of two rented locations in Yerevan: one is a shop in the central street and one is a place at the trade fair.

Arsen sells women’s clothes such as blouses, skirts, trousers, and dresses. Arsen is requesting a loan in the amount of $2,000 to add overcoats and jackets to his inventory. He hopes to increase his business through these purchases, because this kind of outer clothing is in popular demand during the winter months in Armenia.

She started her business four years ago and reports that her major challenge has been insufficient capital to expand her business. She is therefore requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000. She will use this loan to buy shoes and groceries in bulk in order to get a better price. She sends a big thank you to Kiva lenders.

She hopes that this loan will help her build a business that will be profitable and provide benefits for her children. She thanks you for your support.

She hopes to increase her profits this festive season. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks and food to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

texts.en:
Pauline sells bags of garri (cassava flakes) at wholesale prices to her customers. Garri is an essential commodity in Nigeria and the demand for it is high. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits.

Pauline is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Pauline is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell.

Pauline is 42 years old and is married with three children. Her husband is a businessman. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

texts.en:

A specialist in school uniforms for both sexes and for those in the primary level, Kofi has been sewing for 12 years now, employing various styles appropriate for school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit dresses, funeral clothes, wedding dresses, etc.

He is requesting a loan to buy increased supplies of sewing material including linen, threads, and thimbles to increase his output and efficiency. Kofi hopes to increase his savings to provide for both the business and rising family expenses. He would be grateful for your assistance and support.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing material to increase his output and efficiency.

Esther runs a foodstuffs business selling rice, beans, yams, etc. Since she started the business nine years ago, it has been improving; part of the profit goes back to the business while the rest goes to support her family. Esther is requesting a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

This Christmas season, she is sure to turn over the loan positively and hopes to pay on time.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more products for sale

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: "Yaa" is her name, which means Thursday born.  She is 70 years old, married and mother to three children who are all currently working and independent.  She sells cereals like rice, beans, maize and gari etc. at the local market in her community. She has spent most of her life, about 51 years, in this trading business.  She has lots of selling experience to win customers. She is an achiever and her focus is to save for the future, as she is growing older and older. Yaa wants to use the loan to buy stocks of maize, beans, and gari as she enters into the Christmas season. She is grateful for this assistance.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of maize, beans, gari etc.

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en:
Kareem, 39 years old, is married with two children. She sells sandals in various sizes and designs, while her husband is into fashion designing. She has been in this business for over 6 years, and hopes to improve her business by buying in bulk directly from the producers, as well as becoming a major supplier.

She is the leader of Temi-Tope Union. She needs a loan amount of NGN 170,000 to purchase more sandals to sell and attract more customers. Kareem believes that having an assortment of good quality sandals will increase her sales. She says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more quality sandals to sell.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida, 38 years old, is married and a mother of three children who are currently in school. She works hard to support her husband in providing food, health and other support for her children. She is determined to provide for her children through hard work and commitment. Vida has been selling cosmetics in the market center of the community where she lives, and also sells during market days in the surrounding communities. She has been in business close to three years now. She says selling of cosmetics is very lucrative.  She wants to expand her inventory, which will make a good income, enabling her to sponsor her children's education. Also, as we enter into Christmas season, she believes the loan assistance will help increase her sales. She is so sure that your loan support will bring her the results she wants.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetics and baby products.

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah sells bags of garri (cassava flakes) at wholesale prices to his customers. Garri is an essential commodity in Nigeria and the demands for it are high. This is the high season for his business and he hopes to make more profits.

He is a LAPO client.  LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Africa, particularly Nigeria.

He is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell. Micah is 36 years old and married with 2 children. His wife is a trader. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 34 years old, married and the mother of four children. Her last born, who is just a few months old, is still breastfeeding, whiles the rest are currently in school. She operates a clothing shop and sells denim clothing, blouses, skirts, women's slippers, dressing bags and cooking utensils, etc.  

She started this business ten years ago. She is constrained by funds to run the business as we enter into the Christmas season. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up the progress of her business.

She believes the loan will give her more resources to purchase good quality items in large quantity to upgrade her inventory. She wants to use the loan to purchase denim clothing, ladies wear, headscarves and slippers. With the loan, she hopes to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To purchase denim clothing, ladies wear, slippers and cooking utensils in bulk.

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine sells bags of garri (cassava flakes) at wholesale prices to her customers. Garri is an essential commodity in Nigeria and the demands for it are high. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits.

She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Africa, particularly Nigeria.

She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell. Maurine is 30 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband is a business man. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Khardiata

texts.fr:
Madame Khardiata N. est une femme dynamique qui habite a Yoff dans la localité  de Ngaparou. Elle a 37 ans et est membre de l’U-IMCEC depuis décembre  2004.Elle a déjà bénéficié  de 5 prêts  antérieurs  qu’elle a correctement rembourse. C’est une femme mariée  mère  d’un enfant de 13ans et son mari a immigre. Madame Khardiata est très  connue car elle a longtemps évolue  dans une troupe de danse basée  a Yoff appelée  Gualgui  de Yoff. .Madame Khardiata a compris qu’elle pouvait exploiter cette célébrité  et elle s’est adonnée  depuis le mois de mai 2009 au commerce de produits cosmétiques, mercerie, tissus et divers autres. Par conséquent  elle sollicite un crédit de  500 000 frs dans l’objectif de renforcer son stock et d’acquérir  des nouveautés  en vue des préparatifs  des fêtes  de tabaski et de nouvel an. Madame N. vit dans sa maison familiale  et  a en charge 5 personnes .Elle participe beaucoup dans les dépenses  quotidiennes. L’accroissement de ses revenus va lui permettre de mieux assister cette famille a améliorer  leurs conditions de vie sociale.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les femmes  a exercer des activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Ms. Khardiata N. is a dynamic woman who lives in Yoff in the Ngaparou locality. She is 37 years old and has been a member of U-IMCEC (one of Kiva's field partners) since December 2004. She has already benefited from 5 previous loans that she repaid properly. She is a married woman and the mother of one child aged 13, and her husband has immigrated. Ms. Khardiata is very well known because she has been involved for a long time with a dance troupe based in Yoff, named Gualgui de Yoff. Ms. Khardiata learned that she could make use of this fame, and since May 2009 she has devoted herself to the sale of cosmetics, dressmaking supplies, fabric, and various other items. As a result, she is seeking a loan of 500,000 frs, with the goal of strengthening her stock and acquiring new supplies, given the upcoming preparations for the holidays of Tabaski and New Year's. Ms. N. lives in her family house and has 5 people in her care. She participates a lot in providing for the daily expenses. The increase in her income will allow her to better help this family improve their social and living conditions. Always with the goal of actively participating in the struggle against poverty, U-IMCEC, with the positive support of lenders, succeeds in helping women run lucrative revenue-generating activities, which promotes much-desired socio-economic development.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is 60 years old. She is married and the mother of nine children. Currently all her children are independent. She is sells smoked fish and started her fish sales forty years ago at a community market where she lives. It is through this business that she was able to cater for her children until they became independent.

Ama buys fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She says it is very affordable from that place, though that is quite a distance. With her little capital she cannot buy in bulk and sees that as a cost to her operation, considering the distance where she purchases her stock. She serves her customers with very tasty and good quality smoked fish, and because of that many customers buy from her stand.

Ama buys fish from the fishmongers sometimes when demand is high. She has a large customer base who travel from other parts of surrounding communities to buy her fish. She requests the loan to upgrade her stock of fish. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed operates a grocery store in his neighborhood. He is a 34-year-old, married with no children. He sells products like rice, canned foods, drinks, candies, etc.

With the loan, Mohammed wants to buy more products to increase his stock of goods. He would appreciate your assistance very much.

loans.use: Buy more products to increase his stock of goods

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 55 years old. He is married and the father of four children. Among his children, there is only one who is in school whilst the rest are doing something on their own just to survive.

Ali is from Burkina Faso which is a neighboring country to Ghana. He moved here to Ghana with his family in search of greener pastures. Currently he is a fisherman and also sells animals (sheep) to make a living. He does not downplay when it comes to business and family. Sheep sales had been his major source of income until he moved to Ghana where he started fishing. He has been in business for the last nine years now. He requests the loan to buy additional fishing nets and sheep in bulk. He hopes to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and animals like sheep

loans.name: Mbogo Bakyara Tweyombekye, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
R. Alfred is the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. He is 71 years old and married with 8 children while taking care of 4 dependents. Alfred is a farmer from Kigusha cell with farming experience of 29 years and at the moment, he is able to make 200,000/= as profit every month.

Alfred is a loyal person especially to his customers and in future, he would like to have a larger farm as well as educating his children to the highest level, God willing. Alfred needs a loan of 1 million shillings to be able to modernize his farm by buying farm inputs for improved output. Alfred is a determined and hard-working man.

loans.use: Modernising his farm by buying farm inputs

loans.name: Obeng

texts.en:
Obeng is 44 years old. He is married and the father of three children. His children are currently in school. To support his household, he has been selling cereals like maize and groundnuts in the community market to his loyal customers. He also transports a major part of his stock to Kumasi's central market to sell at a competitive price.

Obeng says selling of these products is very lucrative, with his fifteen years' selling experience. He believes providing quality education will happen. He takes delivery of stock from the farming communities. Therefore, he wants the loan to expand his inventory to enable him to make good income to support his family, especially in their education.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like groundnuts and beans

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed works as a lawyer doing legal procedures of all kinds. He lives in Nablus, a city of Palestine. The loan will be used to buy a fax machine and a new computer so he can provide his clients with the best service.

loans.use: To buy a fax machine and a new computer

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a businesswoman who trades in Dumas (a brand name) clothes, linen and lace materials. She sells her goods mainly on credit to her loyal customers through hawking - that is, she uses a personal selling method; this, she said, makes her goods move very fast. She also sells fried yam with hot pepper to supplement her clothing and materials business.

Juliana is 35 years old and is a married mother with four children. All her children are in school. She is supportive of her family through the proceeds she makes from her business.

Juliana has fourteen years selling experience but progress has persistently been slow due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to revive her business and make a profit that is more viable so as to remain in business. She wants to purchase Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials, and yam, vegetables, etc., in bulk to increase her inventory.

It is Juliana’s desire to save more to give her children a better education and a better life.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas clothes in bulk to increase her inventory

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is 30 years old, is married, and is the mother of two children. Currently one is in school and her last born is still breastfeeding. Yaa lives with her children in the Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Yaa is a petty trader who loves selling goods, the business which is her source of livelihood. She has been selling foodstuffs like tubers of yam, maize, etc., for six years now to support her family. She treks to farming communities like Abofour in the Ashanti region of Ghana to buy her stock of foodstuffs. Sometimes she spends days in the villages just to buy a large quantity of foodstuffs. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices.

With this loan, Yaa wants to bulk-buy tubers of yam, maize, etc., to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Mansur

texts.en:
Mansur is married with two children. He sells clothing and shoes at his shop in his city. He also goes out to neighboring villages to sell. Mansur has been in this business for 25 years. He has many consistent customers, especially in villages where there are no markets. Sometimes he takes orders then brings the items to customers when he returns to the village.

Mansur would like to borrow 3000 USD to increase his inventory. He hopes to take better care of his family's needs. His goal is to open a second store in his city.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new goods to sell

loans.name: Olufunke

texts.en:
Olufunke owns a store where she sells frozen foods like turkey and chickens. She purchases her goods from Ogun State and Ibadan. She started this business about ten years ago. She has finish her first Kiva loan and she is grateful to her lenders for the support they have given her, since the loan has improved her business, her standard of living and that of her family has changed; she prays for a better tomorrow. With this kind of business she hopes to increase her earnings in the long run and be able to provide better for her children's education.

She is married with three children. She needs the loan amount of NGN 170,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Zoirjon

texts.en:
M. Zoirjon is 44 years old. He is married with 3 children. Zoirjon makes jewelry and has a shop. He has been in this business already for 12 years. Zoirjon sells jewelry like earrings, rings and chains of gold. His business is doing well and currently he wants to purchase more jewelry to attract more clients with different tastes. With this purpose in mind, he requests a loan of 1000 US Dollars. Zoirjon is a repeat client of IMON with a positive credit history, and he promises to repay this loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of input materials like fragments, precious and semi-precious stones and reagents required for producing of jewelry

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is 35 years old and a petty trader. She is married and mother to five children. All her children are now in school and her husband is a farmer and petty trader.

Adwoa is a very resourceful mother whose hard efforts give hope and transformation to the family. Adwoa supports her kids through the sale of used clothing, curtains and bedsheets. Selling used clothing, curtains and bedsheets has a very big market share in Ghana as brand new ones are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore selling used clothing has created a market for many women.

Adwoa has been in this business for six years now. She travels to a nearby city called Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She normally concentrates on bedsheets and used towels. She believes this loan would help her save for her children's future and also to rent a store to sell out of as she currently sells through hawking.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing

loans.name: Rahbar

texts.en:
N. Rahbar is 48 years old. She is married with three children. She owns a specialized fabrics store at the central market in Istaravshan city. Rahbar works in a sphere of trade where demand is always very consistent and high, because 'national dresses' in Tajikistan are very popular and a very important item of the dowry of any girl.

Rahbar is one of the leading fabrics vendors in the market where she works. She is very persevering and determined in all of her business endeavors, which has helped to sustain her venture for 18 years. Rahbar is a skilled entrepreneur.

When she started this trade, Rahbar decided to implement basic concepts of integrity and hard work into her business to reach ultimate success. This laid a firm foundation for winning results and Rahbar has obviously been a successful small entrepreneur. However, she doesn’t want to stop. She would like to continue to see her venture grow. Today she is requesting a loan of 1500 USD to increase her assorted inventory.

With your help, Rahbar will be able to make her business succeed and support her children's education.

loans.use: Purchasing the new fabrics to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 26 years old, is married, and is the mother of two children, both of whom are in school.

To support her household, Janet has been selling cereals like beans, maize and groundnuts (peanuts) to her loyal customers in the community market. She says the selling of these products is very lucrative. She has been in business for the last ten years now with lots of business experience.

Janet takes delivery of stock from the farming communities in the northern part of Ghana at farm prices. She requests the loan to increase her stock as we approach the Christmas festivities. This, she believes, would enable her to make a good income to support her family, especially with their education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals to sell

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou N. est une femme de 52 ans qui habite a Yoff a la cite Apecsy  2.Elle est membre de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis janvier 2007 et a déjà bénéficié  d’un prêt antérieur Elle est mariée  et mère  de 7 enfants dont l’âgé  varie entre 13 et 35 ans C’est  par amour de l’activité  qu’elle s’est adonnée a la vente de petit déjeuner  dans une école  privée  qui se situe non loin de chez elle .Le développement de son activité depuis 2003 lui  permet de prendre  en charge la scolarité  de ses enfants en charge. Par conséquent  elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs dans le but de d’acheter a des prix plus compétitifs  les denrées  qui lui permettent de préparer  son petit déjeuner  et de les stocker.                                                                                                    
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les femmes  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou N. is a 52 year old woman who lives in Yoff in the Apecsy 2 city. She has been a member of the U-IMCEC bank since January 2007 and has already received a previous loan. She is married and the mother of seven children between the ages of 13 and 35. It was for the love of business that she took up selling breakfast in a private school located not far from her home. The development of her business since 2003 has allowed her to support the education of the children still under her care. She is therefore seeking a loan of 150,000 frs in order to purchase at more competitive prices the foods that enable her to prepare the breakfasts, as well as to stock the foods.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC - with the positive support of lenders - succeeds in supporting women in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable, socioeconomic development.


Translated from French by Jarred Taylor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase in working capital

loans.name: Mutahira

texts.en: R. Mutahira is 30 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Mutahira, being devoted mother, is doing all the best in order her children to be well educated and to make them happy. She is a hard-working woman struggling to feed her children by selling the national fabrics for the national dresses. Mutahira has her trading place in the central local markets of Istaravshan city. She is trying to have a wide range of goods in order to be able to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of her clients with different levels of income. Today, Mutahira feels that with more working capital her business could generate more income, so she is asking for a loan of $1,500 to jump-start the business and raise the family's standard of living. Let's help this incredible mother to give her children a brighter future. loans.use: To purchase new fabrics to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 35 years old, married and the mother of five children. Two kids are currently in school and the others have yet to learn a trade. She trades in yams in the local market in the community where she lives. Her major difficulty is having enough money to support her business. She could not send three of her children to school, so she wants to make money from the business to help them gain vocational training. She requests a loan to buy tubers of yams in bulk to grow her business and boost sales. Comfort would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: Buy increased stock of yams.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia, 27, is married and mother three children who are in school. She works hard to take care of her household.  Patricia enjoys selling goods like cosmetics.  It has been her major source of livelihood for the past seven years. She says selling cosmetics is lucrative and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers. Patricia does not have a shop at the moment so she sells on top of a table and by hawking. She sells hair and body products like perfume, hair cream, pomade etc., as well.  Patricia wants to use the Christmas opportunity to make business progress. She will purchase more stock of cosmetics to increase her inventory and income, with a loan.

loans.use: Buy more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua, 32, is married with five children. Four are in school and one is breastfeeding. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood.  Akosua is a very skillful, innovative, creative and talented hair dresser.  She also sells yams and charcoal to make more profit. She has been in business for ten years. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service.  Akosua wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like shampoo, activators and food stuffs like yam and charcoal etc. to serve her customers.  With the loan she believes she will be able to make enough profit to provide for her children's education.

loans.use: Buy hair products to meet the needs of customers.

loans.name: Murotjon

texts.en:
Murotjon R. is 27 years old and he lives with his wife and three children.  He has grown vegetables and wheat for more than four years.  His small plots are close to his home, which gives him plenty of time to care for his crops, family and children. The hard part is transporting his products into cities to sell, because of the scarcity of buses.  Murotjon gets most of his enthusiasm from his family. He will use his loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer, to increase his production and therefore his income. With your help, Murotjon will get ahead. He is counting on your help. 

--------------------------------------

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds  fertilizer for sowing wheat and seasonal vegetables.

loans.name: Gulrukhsor

texts.en:
Gulrukhsor U. is 33 years old. She is married with four children.  Gulrukhsor sells jewelry and has been in business for more than three years. Today she requests $1000 loan to purchase new items like earrings, rings, bracelets, and chains to increase the variety of goods she sells. This is the fifth loan for Gulrukhsor and she promises to observe all procedures concerning the payment of the loan, as she has with her previous loans. 
------------------------------------------------------------------
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the new jewelry items to sell.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is a 45-year-old woman. She is widowed and the mother of two children, both of whom are schooling. She works very hard to support her children’s basic needs.

Faustina is a food vendor who sells rice and stew in the community where she lives. She started her operation about three years ago in order to take care of her entire family.

Faustina’s food production is on a low scale because of inadequate funds to support her business. She wants to use the loan to buy more meat, vegetables, and bags of rice to produce in larger quantities and to increase her efficiency. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income.

Faustina also wants to make her children happy as we enter into the Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa, as she is popularly called by her numerous customers, is a 36-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and blessed with five children and all her children are in school.

Adwoa prepares and serves local food like “banku”, rice balls, etc. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is taken with hot pepper or soup. Rice balls are prepared from rice and are also taken with soup. Adwoa has been in business for the last two years in order to feed her family. Her food is tasty and very affordable and, because of that, many buy from her.

Adwoa says the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditures. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.
