Adwoa would be grateful for your assistance and has no regrets about her current food business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Biola Grace

texts.en:
Grace is excited to take out a loan with Kiva. She owns a store where she does her fashion business and also sells and rents out Video CDs which are in high demand. She says she makes a lot of profit from the business and so wishes to improve the business. She has been over 8 years in the business and 2 years in LAPO.

Grace puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. Grace is 33 years old and married with one child. She purchases her CDs from Alaba Int’l market. She is requesting the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell and more Video CDs to sell as well as for renting out. She says a big thank you to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and Video CDs to sell and rent out

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is 30 years old and the mother of two children who are schooling. She is very hard-working and resourceful for her family. She sells charcoal in her neighborhood. Charcoal is very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes. Afia obtains her supply of charcoal from Kintampo in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana.

Currently she picks up only about 100 bags; meanwhile the demand is higher and more than what she buys from the market. She wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of charcoal to increase her inventory. She hopes the loan would enable her to increase savings to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of charcoal

loans.name: Zarofat

texts.en:
U. Zarofat is 54 years old. She and her husband have raised two children who are already married and living independently. For more than 12 years, Zarofat has been selling jewelry. As a rule she works in a store, however she also has a sales point in the local market.

Zarofat sells jewelry items in the oriental national style. She has her customers and those clients who sell their jewelry to her. People trust Zarofat, knowing that she is very honest when assessing the prices and quality. The business of Zarofat is the main source of income for her family.

Zarofat has been working with IMON for more than 4 years. She has proved herself an honest and reliable borrower. Today she requests 2500 US Dollars. With the loan Zarofat plans to purchase new items of jewelry like earrings, rings and bracelets in the oriental style. She thanks all for support and promises to repay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new items of jewelry in the national style

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 37 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. All her children are currently in school. To support her household, she has been selling cereals like beans, maize, and groundnuts, etc. in the community market to her loyal customers. She says selling these products is very lucrative and with her nine years' experience, she can increase her market size. She takes delivery of stock from the farming communities. Therefore, she wants the loan to expand her inventory to enable her to make good income to support her family, especially the children’s education and her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like groundnuts and beans

loans.name: Yesu Mo Group

texts.en:
Theresa is 59 years old ;she is married with four children. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She deems this a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers, as we approach Christmas festivities and with her seven years' experienced in retailing. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body lotion, detergent and hair creams etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for the children's education.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Yesu Mo’ which literary means 'Thank you, Jesus'. She is the one sitting in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan. They would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Oka

texts.en:
Oka sells bags of garri (cassava flakes) at wholesale prices to her customers. Garri is an essential commodity in Nigeria and the demands for it are high. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits.

Oka is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO  is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Oka is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell.

Oka is 35 years old and is married with three children. Her husband is a businessman. Oka says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Kashangura Tukore Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
K. Claire is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is 50 years old and married with seven children aged from 28 to 12 years. She also takes care of three dependents.

Claire has been involved in the sale of produce at Kashangura Trading Centre for nine years. She says that she is successful because of her customer loyalty and she hopes to expand further in business. She would also like to have all her children educated so that they become self-reliant in future.

Claire needs a loan to be able to buy more produce for resale since running out of stock means losing out on some of her customers. She is such a determined and hardworking lady with a strong drive to succeed.

loans.use: To buy more agricultural produce for resale

loans.name: Elliot

texts.en: Elliot is a hard-working young man. He is 39 years old, married with a child. His child is 5 years old and attends a government primary school in Delta state. Elliot is a farmer; he owns a piggery farm where he raises and sells pigs to make a living.  He has been in this business for four years. He hopes to expand this business and this requires a lot of money. He is requesting the loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more piglets to raise and sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing is 50 years old, married with six children. Her husband is a retired civil servant. Blessing has a fish pond and pig farm. She has been in this business for 10 years. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family. She hopes for business expansion. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more fingerlings and piglets to raise and sell. This is the high season for her business.

Blessing is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Blessing is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To purchase more fingerlings and piglets

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola is 39 years old, married with four children. She deals in building materials. Her husband is in a similar business. Bukola has been a member of Owonikoko group for two years now. She has been in this business for over 11 years and she says the business is moving well. She needs the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more building materials to sell. With this kind of business she hopes to increase her earnings in the long run and be able to provide better for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a tailor, sewing clothes for both men and women, and she also sells sarongs of various colors. Her primary customers are residents, neighbors and friends. She is very creative and hardworking. She has been in this sewing business for five years and hopes for a bigger stall in the future.

Doris is 28 years old and is married with a child. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports the home.

Doris hopes to employ more hands to enable her to reach a larger number of customers in this festive season. She is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase a sewing machine and more sarongs. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Doris is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Life Group

texts.en:
Rose is 36years old she is married and mother with six children. Among the children one is schooling and the rest are currently working. Margaret is resourceful mother who works very hard to provide food for the children. She is a petty trader who sells in the community market of Offinso where she lives. She sells items like cassava, spices, vegetables, yam etc. and she has been in business for thirty years now. She requests the loan to buy more food stuffs like cassava, yam, vegetables etc. She takes delivery of stock from the farming communities. She would be grateful for your assistance.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Life’. She is the one sitting in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty trader, food vendors and farmers respectively. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan. They would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk.

loans.name: Ishongororo Twekundire Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
B. Loy is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is 50 years old and a very hard working, determined, and happy lady with a farming business in Ishongororo from where she is able to make 80,000 Ugandan shillings (about $27 US) as profits a month. She ensures that she has quality products and she hopes to have a modern farm in the future since she also has a kraal (corral) of cows and goats at her homestead.

Loy is married with six children, all of whom dropped out of secondary school, and she takes care of four dependants, including paying their school fees. She hopes to have her dependants attain the best education--more than what her own children have. She needs a loan to help expand her business by buying more farm inputs for better production.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Lina Almeida

texts.pt:
Lina Almeida M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, tem 44 anos de idade, separada e mãe de 5 filhos de 27, 25, 21, 19 e 13 anos de idade, todos ainda vão a escola. Fez 10ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições. Vive na casa cedida pelos pastores da igreja Nazareno com os seus filhos e ainda sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ele.

Saiu de Maputo com seus pais Para o Reino da Suazilândia, pais vizinho de Moçambique. Volta em 1980 depois de se juntar ao seu marido, mais tarde inicia o seu negócio onde conta com uma empregada e faz cerca de 10 horas de trabalho por dia. É dona do negocio a mais de 21 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 15.000.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Já teve empréstimos na cooperativa de crédito TCHUMA tendo parado por varias insatisfações. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes desta instituição e este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, feijão, óleo e outros) para aumentar e diversificar ainda mais a sua mercadoria de forma a satisfazer a sua clientela. O empréstimo anterior foi de 14.500.00mt para a mesma actividade.
 
Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para expandir a actividade assim como montar um estaleiro de venda de material de construção.
texts.en:
Lina Almeida M. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of Maputo. She is 44 years old, separated from her husband, and the mother of 5 children who are 27, 25, 21, 19 and 13 years old. All of her children are still in school. Lina completed 10th grade but did not continue due to a lack of resources. She lives in a house she inherited from the pastors of the Nazarene Church. She lives with her children and 2 grand-children whom she also supports. She left Maputo with her parents to move to the neighboring country of Swaziland. She returned in 1980 after meeting her husband and later she started her business [a general store]. Today she has one employee and works about 10 hours per day. She has been the owner of this business for more than 21 years and earns about 15.000.00mt per month that pays for household expenses and allows her to save some in her bank account. She had previously been a loan client of the TCHUMA organization, but stopped due to several dissatisfactions. She heard about Hluvuku through friends who are also loan clients. This is her second loan, for 20.000.00mt that she will use to buy products (peanuts, beans, oil and others) to increase and diversify her merchandise in order to satisfy her clientele. Her previous loan was for 14.500.00mt that she used for the same purpose. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to expand her business .

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase peanuts, beans and other products for resale

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is 35 years old; she is married and has four children. Her husband is a trader. Her children are still dependent upon her and go to school.  She mills palm fruits into cooking oil to sell. Cooking oil is very essential in the preparation of soup in Nigeria. With this business, she assists her husband in meeting the basic needs of their home. 

The Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa, and Christiana is a committed (LAPO) client.  She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more palm fruits to mill into cooking oil to sell, in the hopes of expanding her business.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to mill and sell.

loans.name: Carlota Antonio

texts.pt:
Carlota C. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, tem 37 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 17 e 14 anos de idade, todos ainda vão a escola. Fez 5ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e ainda sustenta 1 neta e irmã que vivem com ela.

Saiu do bairro de Maxaquene com a sua família para o Distrito de Boane ainda muito jovem, onde vive ate hoje. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 20 anos conta com uma empregada e faz cerca de 10 horas de trabalho por dia. Vende roupa usada especialmente lençóis tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.500.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (fardos de roupa usada) para aumentar a quantidade da mercadoria de forma a satisfazer a demanda dos seus clientes. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.000.00mt e 11.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
 
Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para abrir uma nova banca de venda de brinquedos para crianças.
texts.en:
Carlota C. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of Maputo. She is 37 years old, single, and the mother of 2 children, ages 17 and 14. Both of her children still attend school. Carlota completed 5th grade but did not continue her studies due to a lack of resources. She lives in her own home with her children and also supports her granddaughter and her sister who lives with her. She left the Maxaquene neighborhood with her family to move to Boane District when she was very young, and she still lives there today. She has had her own business for the past 20 years. She has one employee and works about 10 hour per day. She sells used clothing, especially linens and sheets. She earns about 5.500.00mt per month which pays for her household expenses and allows her to save some money in her bank account. She has never had loans with other banks. She heard about Hluvuku through friends that are also loan clients. This is her 3rd loan, for the amount of 20.000.00mt that she will use to buy products (used clothing in bulk) to increase her merchandise and satisfy her clients. Her previous loans were for 6.000.00mt and 11.000.00mt and were used for the same purpose. In the future she would like to apply for more loans in order to open a second store for children’s toys.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: used clothing for resale

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 50 years old; he is married and has five children. His wife is a farmer. His children are still dependent upon him and go to school.  Godfrey mills palm fruits into cooking oil to sell. Cooking oil is essential in the preparation of soup in Nigeria.  With this business, he supports his wife in meeting the basic needs of their home. 

The Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa, and Godfrey is a committed LAPO client.  He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more palm fruits to mill into cooking oil to sell, in the hopes of expanding his business.  He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to mill and sell

loans.name: Quezia Titos Messane

texts.pt:
Queizia Titos Messane N. nasceu na cidade de Nampula, Província de mesmo nome, tem 41 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos de 26, 22 e 11 anos de idade, 2 destes ainda vão a escola. Fez 9ª classe e decidiu ingressar no curso de formação de parteiras, para começar a trabalhar para o sustento da familia. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e ainda sustenta a mãe e 2 netas que vivem com ela.

Saiu de Nampula com os seus pais para o Distrito de Xai-xai, Província de Gaza. Tempos depois saiu de Xai-xai para a cidade de Maputo a procura de emprego, depois da formação como enfermeira ha 8 anos, foi destacada para trabalhar no posto de saúde de Massaca como parteira. Faz cerca de 8 horas por dia em regime de turnos e aufere um salário mensal de 3.750.00mt e conta com uma ajuda do seu filho no valor de 2.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, blocos, chapas de zinco e pedra) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. O empréstimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua obra, mobilar a casa e oferecer o melhor conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Queizia Titos Messane was born in the city of Nampula in the province of the same name. She is 41 years old and a single mother of three children who are 26, 22 and 11 years old. Two of them are still in school. She completed 9th grade and decided to take classes to be a midwife so that she could start working to provide for her family. She owns the house she lives in with her children and also supports her mother and two granddaughters who live with her.

She left Nampula with her parents to go the the District of Xai-xai, in the Gaza Province. A while later she left Xai-xai for the city of Maputo in search of a job. After her training as a nurse 8 years ago, she was assigned to work at the Massaca clinic as a midwife. She works in 8-hours shifts daily and receives a monthly salary of 3.750.00mt. Her son also helps with 2.000.00mt which is spent in household expenses. She also invests some money in her savings account.

She has never requested a loan from other banks. She discovered Hluvuku through friends who are also members. This will be her second loan. She requests 15.000.00mt to buy building materials (sand, blocks, zinc plates and stones) to continue her construction. The previous loan was for 10.000.00mt used for the same activity.

In the future, she would like to request more loans to finish her construction, furnish her house and provide more comfort for her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials (cement, blocks and others)

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland is 37 years old; he is married and has a child. His wife is a trader. His child is still dependent upon him and goes to school.  Roland mills palm fruits into cooking oil to sell. Cooking oil is essential in the preparation of soup in Nigeria. With this business, he supports his wife in meeting the basic needs of their home.

The Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa, and Roland is a committed LAPO client. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more palm fruits to mill into cooking oil to sell, in the hopes of expanding his business. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to mill and sell.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bolanle is married with four children, and she is 40 years old. She is a devoted member of LAPO for two years. She sells sarongs in a major market in Lagos state. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 140,000 to add to her business capital. She would like to purchase more sarongs in large quantity to sell and make more profit. With the profit of the businesses, she is able to support her family's basic needs and other necessities. With the loan, she plans to expand her sarongs business, which is now booming. With this kind of business she hopes to increase her earnings in the long run and be able to provide for her children's education. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Ms. Peace K. is a business woman dealing in second hand bags and bed sheets. She owns a lock-up,number 8A, where she operates her  from. She lives in Katete with her husband and their family of two children . She will use the loan to purchase supplies of second hand bags to resell and expand her business. She is a hardworking business woman who promises to work very hard to increase on the profit margins.

loans.use: To purchase supplies of second hand bags for resale.

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.en:
Yuriy is married. He sells fishing equipment at the local market in Vinogradovo city. Yuriy started this business 4 years ago. His kiosk is located right in the center of the market. There is almost no competition at this market, so Yuriy's business goes well. His income is about 3,000 UAH per month.
Yuriy would like to develop his business further. He wants to purchase more inventories to attract more clients. He wants to borrow 11,000 UAH to cover the demand he has at the moment. Yuriy invests most of his income back into his business.

loans.use: to purchase a larger inventory of fishing equipment to sell

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 40 years old. He is married and has 5 children. His wife is a retail seller. His children are still dependent upon him and go to school. Samson is a committed LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. 

Samson mills palm fruits into cooking oil to sell. Cooking oil is very essential in the preparation of soup in Nigeria. With this business, he supports his wife in meeting the basic needs of the home. He hopes to expand his business. He is requesting for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase a larger supply of  palm fruit to mill into cooking oil to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruit to mill and sell.

loans.name: Zudaida Benedito

texts.pt:
Zubaida Benedito V. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, tem 22 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 1 filho de 2 anos de idade. Frequenta 11ª classe numa Escola ( Orfanato Casa Do Gaiato). Vive na casa própria com a sua família, o marido é facilitador neste orfanato. Sustenta a sua tia que vive com ela em Boane no Bairro da Massaca.

 Nunca saiu da Província de Maputo, vive e trabalha no Distrito de Boane desde a sua infância. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 6 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e faz cerca de 10 horas de trabalho por dia. Vende mais cerveja e refrescos, consegue um rendimento de cerca de 2.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amiga e colega que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (vinhos, cervejas refrescos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 11.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
 
Tem como objectivo diversificar o produto para a satisfação da sua clientela assim como aumento da sua renda. 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para iniciar com a criação de frangos de corte e abrir uma mercearia.
texts.en:
Zubaida Benedito was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name. She is 22 years old and the married mother of a two year old. She is in the 11th grade at the school of the Casa do Gaiato Orphanage. She lives with her family in her own house. Her husband is a facilitator at the Orphanage. She supports her aunt who lives with her in the Boane district, in the Massaca neighborhood.

She has never left the Maputo province, having lived and worked in the Boane district her whole life. She has had her own business for more than six years. She has no employees and works around ten hours a day. By selling mostly beer and sodas she makes around 2.500.00mt per month which goes toward household expenses and savings.

She has never had loans from other banks. She discovered Hluvuku through a colleague and friend who is also a member. This will be her second loan. She requests 15.000.00mt to buy supplies (wine, beer, sodas and others) in order to increase her inventory. The previous loan was for 11.000.00mt and was used for the same activity.

Her goal is to diversify her inventory to please her clientele and also to increase her income. She would like to request more loans in the future to start breeding chickens for sale and to open a general store.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of sodas, beer and other products

loans.name: Byabasiita Group, Ibanda

texts.en: Willy N. is a good person. He is 40 years old and married with 5 children in primary and secondary schools.  Willy has a retail shop and a bar in the Byabasiita trading centre and has managed both businesses for 9 years. He is able to make profit which enables him take care of his family, his children’s education and general duties. He says that good customer care has helped him succeed. In the future, he would like to become richer and provide his family with a better living condition. Willy needs a loan to be able to boost his business, as the profits he makes help him to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: Restocking his retail shop and bar with more products to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Cacilda

texts.pt:
Rosa Cacilda D. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, tem 52 anos de idade, separada e mãe de 5 filhos de 29, 27, 24, 21 e 10 anos de idade todos vão a escola. Fez somente 5ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e sustenta 6netos que vivem com ela.

Saiu da cidade da Matola para o bairro Patrice Lumumba para viver em 1975. Em 1996 separa se do seu marido e vai a Boane fixar sua nova residência, onde vive actualmente com seus filhos. Tem um negócio próprio no seu quintal onde trabalha das 7h as 22horas, dependendo do movimento de compras. Aprendeu esta actividade desde 1985 devido a varias dificuldades encaradas na sua vida quotidiana. Não possui empregados, consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mes, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia e ferro) para ampliar a sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 13.600.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.
 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua obra para oferecer o melhor conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Rosa Cacilda was born in the city of Matola, in the Maputo province. She is 52 years old, divorced and the mother of 5 children. Her children are 29, 27, 24, 21, and 10 years old and they are all in school. She went to school until the 5th grade and didn't continue because her parents could not afford her to. She lives in her own house with her children and six grandchildren.

In 1975, she left Matola to live in the Patrice Lumumba neighborhood. In 1996, she separated from her husband and settled in Boane where she currently lives with her children. She has her own business in her backyard. She works from 7am to 10pm, depending on the flow of customers. She started this activity in 1985 due to a number of hardships she has faced in her day to day life. She does not have any employees and has an income of around 5.000.00mt per month which goes toward household expenses and savings in Xitique, a traditional rotational savings system.

She has never had loans from other banks. She discovered Hluvuku through neighbors who are also members. This will be her fourth loan. She requests 15.000.00mt to buy building materials (cement, stones, sand and iron) to increase the size of her house. The previous loans were for 5.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt and 13.600.00mt and were all used for the same activity.

In the future, she would like to request more loans to finish her construction and offer more comfort to her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials (cement, stones, sand and iron)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 50 years old; she is married and has five children. Her husband sells building materials. Her children go to school and are still dependent on her. She mills palm fruits into cooking oil to sell. Cooking oil is very essential to the preparation of soup in Nigeria. With this business, she assists her husband in meeting the basic needs of their home. She hopes to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more palm fruits to mill into cooking oil to sell. 

Esther is a committed LAPO client, and LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and throughout Africa. Esther says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to mill and sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a member of LAPO microfinance. She runs a sewing service and also sells drinks. She is 24 years old, single and hopes to become a high class fashion designer and to have a comfortable home in the future. She is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sewing materials and more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing materials and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Ms. Aisha N. is a resident of Kukyeka Kamukuzi division in Mbarara district. She is a businesswoman and owns a grocery shop which she has been operating for over five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase additional grocery items (drinks, sugar, soap, cooking oil, and so forth) to meet the demands of her customers. She is a widow and runs her business on her own. She hopes to earn enough from her business to be able to afford to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her store

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel A. is 41 years old, is married and has 4 children. His wife is a trader. His children are still dependent upon him and go to school. Daniel is a committed LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. Daniel mills palm fruits into cooking oil to sell. Cooking oil is very essential in the preparation of soup in Nigeria. With this business, Daniel supports his wife in meeting the basic needs of the home. He hopes to expand his business. Daniel is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more palm fruits to mill into cooking oil to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to mill into cooking oil to sell

loans.name: John Baptist

texts.en: John Baptist K. is twenty-nine years old. He is a married man blessed with two children. John owns a motorcycle garage located in the Lyantonde trading center. He has been operating his business for over nine years. He is requesting a loan to invest in purchasing spare parts and other material for his garage business. John hopes to be successful and expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: To invest in purchasing spare parts for his garage business

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing U. is 35 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband is a business man. Her children are still dependent upon her and go to school. Blessing is a committed LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. Blessing mills palm fruits into cooking oil to sell. Cooking oil is very essential in the preparation of soup in Nigeria. With this business, Blessing helps her husband in meeting the basic needs of the home. She hopes to expand her business. She is requesting for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more palm fruits to mill into cooking oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to mill into cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Revecata

texts.en:
Revecata M. is a hardworking business woman running a drug shop located in the Kisenyi Kakoba division. She has five children, two of whom are going to school. Revecata is requesting a loan to purchase drug shop items such as various tablets and general medicine products, to meet the demand of her customers. Revecata hopes to open up a retail shop next year to increase her income. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

loans.use: To purchase drug shop items such as various tablets and general medicine products

loans.name: Kyegwisa Bakyara Group, Ibanda

texts.en: Ovia K. is 35 years old and married with 5 children all in primary and secondary schools. She has had a retail shop in the Kyegwisa trading centre for 10 years. Ovia needs a loan to be able to buy more sugar, cooking oil, paraffin, maize flourand bread to expand her shop and make more profit.  In the future, Ovia hopes to develop the shop into a wholesale enterprise as well as have all her children educated at the University.

loans.use: Buying more sugar, cooking oil, paraffin, maize flour, bread for her shop

loans.name: Romina

texts.en:
Romina sells cooking oil at retail prices to her customers. Cooking oil is very essential in the preparation of soup in Nigeria. She makes a good profit because the demand for her cooking oil is high. She hopes to expand her business, but the challenge she is faced with is insufficient funds. She is requesting a loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more cooking oil to sell.

Romina is 40 years old and married with four children. Her children are still dependent upon her and go to school. She is a committed LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. 

She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Mr. A. Tom owns a pub in Ibanda Town Council, Katooma 2 Cell.  He is 31 years old and married with three children, two of whom are going to school. 

He wants to use the loan to purchase more soft drinks for his pub business. He aspires to obtain a large scale pub to attract the best customers, which will help him achieve a good profit.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks for his pub business.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim, 34, is married with four children. She owns a grocery store. Her husband is a commercial driver. 

She is a committed member of LAPO Microfinance. She has been running her business since 2001. She says her expectations are to grow beyond imagination and add more types of food. She is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. 

She says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante 1-5 Group

texts.en:
Despite any difficulties she may face, Xiomara, 48, is excited to be taking out this loan – her very first with Esperanza International. She proudly displays her colmado, or small general store, in which she will invest this loan. She plans to buy more merchandise, including foods, snacks, drinks, gasoline, charcoal, and clothing. Xiomara has never had access to a loan before, and her hopes for both her business and her family now don’t seem so far away. She hopes that with her profits, she and her husband will be able to afford their own home, and maybe even buy a small tract of land to work on someday. Xiomara also hopes to send all of her children to university – an opportunity she never had.

Xiomara is a borrower who lives near La Romana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Con Dios Adelante (Onward with God), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group. They live in Batey San German, a small community north of La Romana. Bateyes are small rural communities built by sugar companies to house their field workers. Like San German, bateyes are usually remote, lack good sanitation and medical services, and have little to no access to potable water and electricity. Xiomara lives in this community with her husband and three children, ages 16, 12, and a 10-year-old named Melvin. Their house has a cement foundation with wooden walls and a tin roof, and it is lent to them by the sugar company.

Thank you for your loan to Xiomara and the Con Dios Adelante group!

loans.use: To buy food, clothing, gasoline, and charcoal

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Mr. T. Geofrey owns a tailoring workshop in Ibanda town, Main Street. He has been in this business for over sixteen years. His experience has enabled him to produce quality work hence hoping to attract more customers.

Geofrey is forty-one years of age and is married with five children of whom four are in school.

Geofrey wants to use the loan to purchase more cloth for his shop for different designs.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth for his shop for different designs

loans.name: Virginia Salvador

texts.pt:
Virgínia Salvador M. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 50 anos de idade, Viúva e mãe de 1 filho que já trabalha numa empresa no Distrito da Manhiça. Fez somente 4ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu do Distrito de Boane para cidade da Matola por uma transferência dos seus serviços em 1994, depois do término do contrato volta a Boane e inicia uma actividade comercial. Actualmente é dona do seu próprio negocio desde 2004, aprendeu esta actividade com suas amigas como alternativa de sobrevivência. Faz cerca de 10horas por dia, não possui nenhum empregado, consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mes e ainda uma pensão da antiga instituição onde trabalhou no valor de 1.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Já teve empréstimos em outros bancos (associação Guê GueGue), conheceu a Hluvuku sozinha quando foi inaugurado o escritório, tendo aproximado e se informar das condições de acesso. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia e ferro) para ampliar a sua casa. O empréstimo anterior foi de 11.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para construir dependências (casas de Aluguer) para aumentar o seu rendimento mensal e oferecer melhores condições de vida a sua família.
texts.en:
Virgínia Salvador M. was born in the District of Boane, Maputo Province, in the south of Mozambique. She is 50 years old and widow. One of her children works for a company in the Manhiça District. She left school just after the fourth grade, because the family could not afford her education. She lives in her own house with her children and she is not providing for anyone else. She left the District of Boane in 1994 and moved for a job to the city of Matola; after ending her contract she returned to Boane and started a business. She has been the owner of her business since 2004 and she has started learning this activity through her friends, in order to be able to provide for the family needs. She works approximately 10 hours every day, she does not have any employees, and she is making a monthly revenue of 3.000 MZN. Besides, she receives, from an old institution where she worked in the past, a 1.000 MZN pension that she uses for the household expenses and for savings in Xitique, a traditional rotational savings system. In the past, she already received loans from other financial institutions (Guê GueGue association); later she found out about Hluvuku, when she went to ask about lending conditions at the just inaugurated office. This is her second loan of the amount of 15.000 MZN, that she will use to buy construction materials (cement, stones, sand and iron) to enlarge her house. The amount of her previous loan was 11.000 MZN, that she invested as well in her house. In the future she is planning to request further loans to build houses to rent next to her house, to increase her revenue and improve the living standards of her family.

Translated from Portuguese by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, stones, sand and iron)

loans.name: Amahia

texts.en:
Amahia is 26 years old and is single without children. She mills palm fruits into cooking oil to sell. Cooking oil is essential in the preparation of soup in Nigeria. With this business, she supports her parents in meeting the basic needs of the home.

Amahia hopes to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more palm fruits to mill into cooking oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Amahia is a committed LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to mill into cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Rashidatu

texts.en:
Rashidatu is a trader who deals in groceries and foodstuffs. She started this business nine years ago and she has been doing well since then. She is 30 years of age and married with three children.

Rashidatu says the only problem she is facing presently is a lack of sufficient capital to boost her business. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. She believes that having a large quantity of foodstuffs will increase her sales since the demand for foodstuffs is high.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike mills palm fruits into cooking oil to sell. Cooking oil is very essential in the preparation of soup in Nigeria. He is 45 years old, married and has three children. His wife is a trader. His children are still dependent upon him and go to school. With his business, he helps his wife meet the basic needs of their home. He hopes to expand his business.

Mike is requesting a loan of 150,000 nairas to purchase more palm fruits to mill into cooking oil to sell. He is a committed LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to mill into cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Kizaara Twihaneyo Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
T. Edson has a hotel and tomato-growing business in Kizaara cell. He is 29 years old and married with four children between the ages of 6 months and 8. He also takes care of two dependants. All his children are in school except for the last born 6-month-old baby.

Edson is able to make 60,000/= profit a week although he has business challenges like low capital and little market for his tomatoes. Edson knows how to treat his customers well and he would like to expand his business further and sell tomatoes wholesale instead of retail. He also hopes his children get the best education for self sustainability. Edson needs a loan to be able to purchase more foodstuffs and seeds to grow tomatoes and maize. Edson is a friendly and hardworking man with a strong drive to succeed.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and seeds

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith sells bags of melon at retail prices to her customers. Melon is used in the preparation of egusi soup in Nigeria. She has been in her business for a long time. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more bags of melon to sell.

Faith is 45 years old and married with four children. Her children are still dependent upon her and go to school. Faith is a committed LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of melon to sell

loans.name: Hanane

texts.en:
Hanane is a married woman, 35 years old. She works in clothing sales from her home and has been involved in this market since 1999. She services the neighboring villages where she has become well known.

Today, Hanane plans to enlarge her business. That's why she is requesting $1,000 to buy additionA. clothes.

loans.use: To buy additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Bunmi

texts.en:
Bunmi is married with three children, and she is 40 years old. Her husband is a transporter in Lagos. She says her husband has been trying to do his best to improve the family’s standard of living but she needed to play her own part in providing the children with the basic necessities of life.

Bunmi is a trader, well known for selling dry yam (yam tubers peeled or sliced, parboiled and sun-dried) and yam flour (milled dry yam). She has been running this business for over nineteen years now.

Bunmi needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more dry yam and yam flour to sell. She hopes that this loan will help her build a business that will be profitable. She says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more dry yam and yam flour to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia sells bags of melon and garri (cassava flakes) at retail prices to her customers. Melon is used in the preparation of egusi soup in Nigeria. She has been in the business for a long time. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more bags of melon and garri to sell.

Felicia is 55 years old and married with six children. Her children are still dependent upon her and go to school. Felicia is a committed LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri (cassava flakes) and melon to sell

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en: Ziad is a 25-year-old married man. He has been working as a blacksmith since 2002 and has 10 years of experience in the field. Today, Ziad is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy specific tools for his work in order to enlarge his business and make a good income.

loans.use: To buy specific tools for his work

loans.name: Dib

texts.en: Dib has been working as a car painter and repairman since 2000. He is a 27-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. Dib does good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. Dib decided on this business because he wanted to have independent work. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase all the needed tools for his garage. Dib requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his third loan cycle and he has always repaid on time. In the future, he plans on improving his business by purchasing more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: To purchase all the needed tools for his garage

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 52 year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Since 1991, Khaled has been selling old and used metal and aluminum. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough products to sell. Khaled is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase aluminum for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.
In the picture, we see Khaled and his pick up which allows how to carry his products from one place to another.

Khaled is special in his work because of his experience in sales. His clients are traders. Khaled decided to begin his business because he wanted to have independent work and because he likes his work. In the future, he plans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase aluminum.

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is a 32 year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife. Mhammad has been driving a van since 2000. He transports students, employees and passers-by. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Mhammad is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his van and save some money to start a new business that will help him increase his income. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

Mhammad is special in his work because of his punctuality. Mhammad decided to start his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans to improve his business.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on his van.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a 39-year-old single man. In 1999, he decided to open his own vehicle tires shop as his own business. He's well known in his town where the clients came to change their car tires. Today, Khalil is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy new tires and vehicule oil to satisfy the needs of the market and of his clients.

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en:
Saeed is a 29 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife. Since 1999, Saeed has been working as a furniture upholsterer. Saeed is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase a sewing machine for his work. This is the first time that Saeed has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

Saeed is known for his good work. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Saeed decided on his business because he learned it when he was young. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa has owned a barber shop since 2000. He also sells hair products like shampoos and gel, and perfumes. He is a 22-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Moussa knows how to treat his clients and does good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase all the needed tools for his shop. Moussa decided on this business because he wanted to have independent work and he learned it in an academy.

Moussa requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to repaint his shop and purchase accessories. This is his second loan cycle and he has always repaid on time. In the future, he plans on improving his business by purchasing more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: To repaint his barber shop and purchase accessories

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline sells bags of rice at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more bags of rice to sell.

Caroline is 44 years old and married with five children. Her husband is a fashion designer and he also supports the family. Her children are still dependent upon her and go to school. Caroline is a committed LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali has been selling fish for 15 years. He is a 50-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Ali sells good quality, clean fish. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. Ali took on his father’s work; therefore, he didn’t face a lot of difficulties since he was already known by the public and had a client base.

Ali has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always repaid on time. His previous loan helped him diversify his merchandise and expand his stock. Ali requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and repair one of his fridges. In the future, he plans to keep improving his business to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and repair one of his fridges

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 22 years old and lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their newborn baby.
Ali has owned a coffee shop for a year, where he offers games such as billiards, bagman, card games, and lots more. He is successful in his work because he does his best to improve his income and is known for his good reputation and the welcome he gives to his customers. His customers are friends, neighbors and others from the region. Ali decided on this line of work because of his experience. He is an active man who does his best to improve his work and increase his income. He has also owned a clothing shop for two years.
Ali requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to alter the décor of his coffee shop – he wants to repaint the walls and make his shop look more attractive. This is his second loan cycle and he has always made his payments on time. His previous loan helped him open his coffee shop and improve his clothing shop by expanding his merchandise.

loans.use: To alter the décor of his coffee shop

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is 44 years old and lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, with his wife and four children. He has owned a mini market for almost three years. He sells home cleaning products, shampoo, toilet paper, and lots more. Mhammad is successful in his work because he opens till late in the evening. His customers are his friends and neighbors. He decided on this line of work because of his experience in sales and his desire to have independent work.
Mhammad requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase his mini market. This is his second loan cycle and he has always made his payments on time. His previous loan helped him improve his shop by diversifying his range of merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase his mini market

loans.name: Katerero Twimukye Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
T. Damiano is 38 years old and married with three children between the ages of four and seven. He also takes care of three orphans. For the last four years, Damiano has run a business in Omwimasiro selling produce, from which he is able to make 50,000 UGX profit a week, although his business is affected by changes in the weather and price fluctuations.
Damiano hopes to expand his business further in order to be able to educate his children for future self-sustainability. He is requesting a loan to increase his stock by buying more produce to sell as a retailer.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin M. M. has a combined M-Pesa/restaurant operation in Tudor area, a suburb of Mombasa. M-Pesa is a widely-used electronic money-transfer system in Kenya based on mobile phones (allowing users to deposit, withdraw, and transfer money and pay bills at very affordable rates without visiting a bank). Benjamin started the restaurant attached to the M-Pesa business to maximize use of the large space. The restaurant serves chicken, french fries, chapati, githeri (maize and beans), and sodas. It is optimally located near a municipal stadium and a school. While there are many bars in the area, currently his is the only restaurant. Benjamin says the area is growing and he feels he is well positioned in terms of location and offering. In addition to the Tudor shop, he has another M-Pesa shop in Tononoka.
Benjamin is 39 years old, married, and has two boys, aged 8 and 12. He hopes his boys will prosper and have their own houses and cars. Benjamin describes himself as business-minded, ambitious, and willing to work hard.

loans.use: To purchase goods for his restaurant, such as chicken, cooking fat, utensils, etc.

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en:
Nkechi is 40 years old, married, and has three school-aged children who are still dependent upon her. She is a very hardworking and friendly woman.
Nkechi sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She loves her business because of the one-to-one interaction she has with her customers. Nkechi is a committed client of Kiva partner, LAPO, which is dedicated to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 39-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Ahmad has owned a bakery for six years, selling “mankoucheh”. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza. The most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Ahmad also sells Lebanese sweets. Ahmad requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials for his bakery. He decided on doing his work because of his experience. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Ahmad has been a micro credit client for five years now and has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him improve his work. Ahmad is special in his work because he is known for his tasty mankoucheh and sweets. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his business to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his bakery.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 26-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Ali has been selling used cars since 2006. When he first started his business, he had some financial issues with purchasing cars. Ali decided on doing his business because it allows him to increase his income and because he had experience in car trading. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a car. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. Ali is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase a car

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en: Ghassan is a 34-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Ghassan has been working as a builder since 1995. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition, especially since he didn’t have a lot of networking. He also had some financial issues. Ghassan is special in his work because he is known for his good work. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Ghassan has requested a loan. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by working in the surrounding villages.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 31-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children.

Mohamad has been working as an electrician since 1999. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition especially because he wasn’t really known in his region. Mohamad is special in his work because he is trustworthy and is known for his good work. 

He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase electrical wires for his work. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan. 

His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by working in surrounding villages.

loans.use: To purchase electrical wires for his work.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 49 years old and is married with three children. Her husband sells beef to support the household. 

Grace owns a restaurant where she sells groceries, Nigerian cooked foods and drinks to make a living. Her primary customers are residents, neighbors and friends. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. 

She wakes up daily at 4:30 am to start the preparation of her cooked foods. She sells for long hours to enable her to meet the basic needs of her family members. 

Grace is a committed LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. 

She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 36-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Mahdi has been working as a contractor since 1990. He also works as home painter. 

He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Mahdi has requested a loan.

When he first started his business, he had to face heavy competition and he had some financial issues. Mahdi is special in his trade because he is known for his good work.

His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Todos Juntos Podemos 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Zoila, 55, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro D. Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Todos Juntos Podemos (Together We Can), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Zoila and the other borrowers live in Consuelito, a small community just north of San Pedro. She has two children, 28 and 26, and lives with her husband. They have a house maD. of cement blocks with a tin roof, a vast improvement over the typical wooden homes of the Dominican Republic. This is Zoila’s very first loan with Esperanza International, and she will use it to invest into her colmado, or small general store. She plans to purchase foods typical of the Dominican diet, including rice and beans, as well as small snacks, juices, and soft drinks. 

Zoila is very wise and she has a servant’s attituD. when it comes to taking out this loan. Although she knows it will greatly support her own business, she hopes to invest time and money into the community so that all can benefit from her successes. Zoila would like to work to “fulfill her community” by continuing to move forward and build better ties between its residents. With your support in this loan, Zoila can work to make that happen. Thank you for lending to Zoila and the Todos Juntos Podemos group!

loans.use: Rice, beans, flour, fruits & vegetables, and beverages

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en: Nisrine is a 27-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with her husband and their child. Nisrine has been working in agriculture since 1998. She plants olives and pomegranates. Nisrine works hard to produce high-quality produce. Her clients are people from her region. Her production has steadily grown since she began her business. She is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to pay for help with harvesting her crops, which will enable her to market more of her produce in a shorter amount of time. This is the first time that Nisrine has requested a loan.

loans.use: To pay for help with harvesting crops

loans.name: Kagongi B.t Group, Ntungamo

texts.en: M. Mable is 31-years old and married with four children aged 6 – 11, all of whom are in primary school. M. cares for five dependants. She has operated a hotel and bar business, and she sells cooked food, beers, sodas and wines. She would like to expand her business and turn her bar into a depot. She hopes to see her children attain the best of education for self sustainability and a brighter future. Mable is requesting a loan to purchase more food stuffs so she can increase her stock and profits. She is the leader of her lending group and a very friendly and hard-working lady.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Riyad

texts.en: Riyad is a 29-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Riyad has been working in agriculture since 2000. He plants fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, watermelon, cucumbers, and green beans. His clients are people from his region. Because there is a lot of agriculture in his region, he faced a lot of competition when he first started his business. Now he is known for growing good produce. His future plans are based on his experience in growing crops. He will continue to work hard and produce more. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua ito purchase new tools for his work. This is the first time that Riyad has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase new tools growing crops

loans.name: Samer

texts.en: Samer is a 29-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Samer has been working as a car electrician for over a year. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding the proper place to open his garage. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region, and now Samer is respected because he has proven to be a trustworthy electrician who does good work. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase tools and equipment so he can continue to build his business. This is the first time that Samer has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by selling spare car parts.

loans.use: To purchase tools and equipment

loans.name: Talal

texts.en: Talal is a 29-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Talal has been working in the construction field since 1999. Since he started his business, he has become known for his good work, and his networking skills have helped him gain more and more clients from people in his region. In the future, he plans on expanding his business. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua  to purchase tools and rope for his work. This is the first time that Talal has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase tools and rope

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad has worked as a fisherman for the past 20 years. He's 44 years old and really likes his job. Today, Ahmad is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy special fishing tools and appliances in order to expand his business. He hopes to fish more and sell more fish to make a good income.

loans.use: To buy special fishing tools and appliances

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad has been working at plowing land. He is a 25-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Imad is known for his good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties.

Imad requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase an irrigation system for his work. This is his second loan cycle and he has always repaid on time. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase an irrigation system

loans.name: Elizabeth De Los Angeles

texts.es: Elizabeth viven en la zona  # 5 de Nueva Guinea,  trabaja como tecnica Municipal desde hace dos años anteriormente se desempeñaba como docente de primaria en una colonia, estudia su tercer año en ciencias de la Educacion  en la Universidad URACCAN,  está solicitando  su 2do refinanciamiento  para invertirlo en construccion  de la cocina de su casa;   Elizabeth se ha caracterizado por ser responsable, honesta, trabajadora y muy querida por sus compañeras de trabajo, ademas ayuda a sus padres  con los gastos familiares del hogar pues son una familia pobre pero bien unida, este prestamo lo piensa pagar en 12 meses y así poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda,  su sueño es ir mejorando la vivienda con cada crédito que va adquiriendo con AFODENIC,  estabilidad laboral, salud y finalizar la licenciatura que actualmente esta estudiando.
texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in zone # 5 in New Guinea. She has worked as a municipal technician for two years. Previously she worked as a primary teacher in a village. She is studying her third year of the Science of Education in the URACCAN University. She is asking for her second loan to build a kitchen in her house. Elizabeth is characterized as being very responsible, honest, and hard-working. She is very dear to her colleagues at work. Also, she helps her parents with the family’s household expenses. They are a poor family, but they are very united. She plans to pay this loan is 12 months. That way she will be improving her house little by little. Her dream is to improve her house with each loan that she gets with AFODENIC, to have work stability, health, and to finish her the degree that she is currently working on.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a kitchen

loans.name: Monicah Wangari

texts.en:
Monicah, a hardworking woman, has been running a grocery business for three years. She is married to Peter and they have two children: Leah and Mary, ages 8 and 2 years old respectively. Monicah's business is situated in a densely populated residential area and has many customers. With this loan she will increase her stock of tomatoes, onions and cabbage to sell in the shop.

Monicah was introduced to KADET by existing clients. This is her first loan and she has no previous loans from other MFIs. With the extra profit she anticipates as a result of this loan, she will add more stock to her business. Since Monicah resides in a rental house, her dream is to grow her business and purchase a piece of land to build her own home.

loans.use: To add stock of tomatoes, onions and cabbage to her grocery shop

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 32 years old. She sells kitchen utensils such as pots, stoves, cutlery, etc. She is married to an electrician who does all kinds of electrical work like the wiring of houses, repairs of electrical appliances, and other electrical work.  They both have three kids.

Victoria is a reliable member of LAPO Microfinance. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell to make more profit so she can support her family by providing the basic necessities of life and give them a good education. Thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils to sell.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La señora Benita es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli” desde hace 2 años atrás, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 43 años de edad, cuenta con estudios secundarios completos, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos.
Benita se dedica a la venta de artesanìa y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró los materiales necesarios para hacer las artesanías.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con los que podrá comprar lana y bayeta.
Su sueño para el futuro es engrandecer su negocio de artesanías y que sus hijos sean profesionales. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Señora Benita has been a member of the community bank "Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli" for two years. The bank is located in the Juli district of Chucuito province in the department of Puno. She is 43 years old and has completed secondary school. She is a single mother and has 2 children.

Benita sells handicrafts. She tells us that with her first loan for 300 PEN from Movimiento Manuela Ramos, she bought the materials needed to make handicrafts. She is asking for a loan of 300 PEN, which she will use to buy wool and felt.

Her goals for the future are to enlarge her handicrafts business and to have her children become professionals. Her favorite thing about the community bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool and felt

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama  B.  est un père de famille de 29 ans .Il  a 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 4 et 7 ans. Il  a  aussi la charge de sa propre Maman. Il est membre de l’U-IMCEC à la caisse de camberene seulement depuis octobre 2009 et n’a jamais bénéficié de prêt au sein de l’institution. Il gère un local dans lequel il procède  à la vente de portables et d’accessoires. Depuis deux ans il s’est focalise sur la vente de cartes de crédit qui est actuellement un domaine tres rentable dans le secteur. L’objet de ce crédit est le renforcement de son stock de cartes. Grace à l’accroissement de ses bénéfices il pourra mieux faire face a ses charges familiales.  
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié
texts.en:
Mr. Adama B. is a 29 year old father. He has two children between 4 and 7 years of age. He also takes care of his own mother. He has only been a member of the Cambérène branch of U-IMCEC since October 2009, and has never received a loan from the institution. He manages a store where he sells cell phones and accessories. For two years he has focused on the sale of mobile calling credit cards, which is currently a very profitable area in the sector. The purpose of this loan is to increase his stock of cards. With his increased profits he can better cope with family expenses.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC - with the positive support of lenders - succeeds in supporting women in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable, socioeconomic development.


Translated from French by Jarred Taylor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: reinforcement of working capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a committed LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Africa, particularly in Nigeria. Rose sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.

She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Rose is a very hard working and friendly woman. She is 42 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a welder. Her children are still dependent upon her and go to school. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Llanilda

texts.es: Lianilda M. es una socia colaboradora y muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 30 años y es madre de dos hijos. Lianilda se dedica a la venta de pescados y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al transporte público. Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace cinco años, donde es muy querida por las demás socias. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que invirtió en en la compra de pescado para vender.
