En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1000.00 nuevos soles los que le permitirán invertir en la compra de una red para pescar. La meta de Lianilda es tener un bote para pescar y seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Lianilda M. is a cooperative and hardworking member of the “Madres Corajes” [Courageous Mothers] Communal Bank. She has been a member for five years and is much loved by the other members. She is 30 years old and a mother of two.

Lianilda is a fish seller and she counts on the support of her husband who is in public transport. Her first loan, for 300 soles, was invested in fish to sell. Now, she is seeking a loan of 1000 soles to buy a fishing net. Her goal is to have her own fishing boat, and continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a fishing net

loans.name: Nadine

texts.en:
Nadine is a 20 year-old young woman. In 2007, Nadine started her own home-based sewing business. She became well known in the whole region for her sewing products.

Today, Nadine is requesting to borrow $1,200 once again in order to buy new sewing tools and introduce traditionA. Lebanese handicrafts to attract more clients.

loans.use: To buy new sewing tools and introduce traditional Lebanese handicrafts.

loans.name: Bessie

texts.en:
Bessie sells fresh tomatoes and peppers at retail prices. She has been in this business for a long time. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand her business. 

Bessie is requesting a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more baskets of tomatoes and peppers to sell. 

Bessie is married with three children. Her husband is a businessman. 

She is a committed LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more baskets of tomatoes and peppers to sell

loans.name: Anna Sugey

texts.es: Anna Sugey  vive en la zona  # 6 de Nueva Guinea, no se ha casado ni tiene hijos pero vive con sus padres a quienes ayuda con los gastos familiares, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construccion de una habitacion ), trabaja como  conserje en la Financiera FAMA  desde hace 5 años,  esta joven se caracteriza por ser una joven honesta y muy trabajadora, y desde muy pequeña se ha esforzado para ayudar a su familia ya que son personas humildes de escasos recursos economicos, actualmente está estudiando  su tercer año en la Universidad URACCAN,  su sueño terminar de construir su vivienda y así gozar de mejores condiciones, terminar de estudiar  y tener estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Anna Sugey lives in zone # 6 in New Guinea. She is not married, and she has no children. She lives with her parents, and she helps them with the family expenses. She is asking for her second loan to improve her house (build a room). She has worked as a counselor for the financial company FAMA for five years. This young woman is characterized as being honest and very hard-working. Since she was very small she has worked to help her family, humble people with scant economic resources. She is currently in her third year at the URACCAN University. Her dream is to finish building her house. That way she will enjoy better conditions, finish her studies, and have work stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Nereida Elena

texts.es:
La señora NEREIDA ELENA M. D. B. tiene 64 años, vive en el distrito D. La Esperanza, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal NUEVA ESPERANZA. La socia presenta estudios hasta 3ero. D. Primaria, refiere que por falta D. recursos económicos sus padres ya no la enviaron al colegio; es casada y tiene 5 hijos todos mayores e independientes. 
Nereida se dedica a la venta D. arroz, gaseosa, leche, golosinas, fideos, yogurt, leche, etc. en la tienda que tiene en su casa y con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles comprò productos para su tienda como: arroz, azúcar, leche, golosinas, aceite, fideos, menestras, etc. para abastecerla.
En la actualidad solicitarà un crédito D. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprará andamios, arroz, azúcar, fideos, menestras, etc. para abastecer màs su tienda.
Ella sueña con aumentar progresivamente los productos que venD. en su tienda para que D. esa manera pueda colmar las necesaidades D. sus clientes y a la vez obtener màs ganancias.
texts.en:
Nereida Elena M. D. Briceño is 64. She lives in the La Esperanza district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Nueva Esperanza Communal Bank. She has a third graD. education. Her parents lacked the economic resources to send her to school. She is married, and she has five grown and independent children. Nereida sells rice, soft drinks, milk, sweets, noodles, and yogurt, etc. in the store that she has in her house. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought products like rice, sugar, milk, sweets, oil, noodles, and vegetables, etc. to stock her store. She is currently asking for a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy shelves, rice, sugar, and vegetables, etc. to better stock her store. She dreams of progressively increasing the products she sells in her store. That way she will meet her customers’ needs and get more income at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more shelves, rice, sugar, noodles, and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Katebo Basooka Kwavula Group, Mpigi

texts.en:
N. Annet is a determined lady. She is married with five children ranging in age from nine to 19 years old.  She takes care of seven dependents in Katebo. 

Annet is a farmer with seven years experience who, at the moment, is able to make 180,000 UGX as a profit per month. 

She is a hardworking lady and is happy that she has a ready market for her produce, hence is full of confidence in what she does. She works hard so that she can buy a truck to ease her own transportation needs, as well as to help educate her children to the highest level. 

She needs a loan to be able to diversify her farming activities and rear more animals. She will also buy more seedlings and animals for expansion.

loans.use: To buy more seedlings and animals like pigs and goats for farm expansion

loans.name: Vero

texts.en:
Vero sells garri (cassava flakes) at retail prices to her customers in the market. Vero is a widow and has four children. Her children are still dependent upon her and go to school. 

Vero is a hardworking woman and hopes for a bigger stall in the future. She is requesting a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more garri to sell. 

She is a committed LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more garri (cassava flakes) to sell

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
La señora GEORGINA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco, Departamento del Cusco. Es Casada, tiene 47 años y es madre de 03 hijos, dos aun están bajo su poder. Melissa tiene 15 años y esta en el quinto grado, Gonzalo tiene 14 años y estas en el tercer grado ambos están en el nivel secundario.      

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de bocaditos (snack) con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario le hacen pedidos porque en ella encuentran todo los bocaditos que se necesita para el negocio de los abarrotes y es quien personalmente les atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más bocaditos de la empresa “KARINTO” de la ciudad de Lima. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mrs. Georgina belongs to the “New Light for Tomorrow” Communal Bank, a part of the Arariwa Association in Cusco province, Department of Cusco. She is married, 47 years old, and the mother of 3 children, two of whom are still dependent on her: Melissa is 15 and in the 5th year of secondary school and Gonzalo is 14 and in the 3rd year of secondary.

Georgina's character and her desire to achieve her dreams motivated her to start her own business selling snacks. This has increased her household earnings. From the outset, she has been wining customers. Now, she can count on a set of customers who ask for her snacks daily, because they can count on her to provide the snacks that they need for their grocery stores, and because she offers her characteristic personal attention. She has been in this business for years and it has gone well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She is an enterprising and hard-working mother who is advancing her family, despite adversities.

Georgina needs the loan to buy more snacks from the “KARINTO” company in Lima. She is very grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and she promises to comply with the payment schedule as charted.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SNACKS TO SELL

loans.name: Julia Magaly

texts.es:
La señora JULIA MAGALY B. M. tiene 40 años, vive en el distrito De La Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú y pertenece al Banco Comunal NUEVA ESPERANZA. 
La socia presenta estudios secundarios completos, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2  dependen económicamente de ella porque se encuentran en edad escolar. 
Julia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos como: talcos, cremas, perfumes, colonias, labiales, delineadores, rimer, etc. y con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò productos como: labiales, colonias, perfumes, desodorantes, shampoos los cuales se encontraban en oferta, por tal pudo aumentar su stock y vender con màs frecuencia.
En la actualidad solicitarà un crédito de 2,300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprará màs cosméticos como: labiales, cremas, perfumes, desodorante, etc. 
Ella sueña con alquilar un stand en un centro comercial para así aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Ms. JULIA MAGALY B. M. is 40 years old and she lives in the De La Esperanza district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department- Perú. She belongs to the Community Bank NUEVA ESPERANZA. The member completed her secondary education; she has a live-in partner and 3 children, 2 of which depend on her economically because they are school-aged. Julia sells cosmetics like: talcum powder, crèmes, perfumes, colognes, lipsticks, eyeliners, mascara, etc. With her first loan of 300.00 nuevos soles, she bought products like: lipstick, colognes, perfumes, deodorants, shampoo that she found on sale, so that she could increase her stock and sell more often. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,300.00 nuevos soles. With that money, she will buy more cosmetics like: lipstick, creams, perfumes, deodorants, etc. She dreams of renting a stand in a mall so she can increase her sales and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy  lipstick, creams, perfumes, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el departamento de Estelí la señora Ivania C. se ha dedicado por varios años a la actividad de venta de bebidas como gaseosas las que son comercializadas a diario en su establecimiento en el que también ofrece alimentos de todo tipo ofrecidos a sus clientes.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una dama muy trabajadora y tiene el deber de mantener a su pequeño hijo en edad escolar por lo que solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de las bebidas y la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos, también con el crédito solventará algunos gastos leves del hogar para continuar brindándole a su familia y en especial su hijo, las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
In the Department of Esteli, Mrs. Ivania has dedicated various years to selling drinks such as soft drinks. She sells them daily in her establishment and she also offers some foods to her customers. She has stood out as a very hard-working woman and she has an obligation, caring for her small school-age son.

For that reason she is soliciting a loan to buy drinks and primary materials to make the food she sells. Also, with this loan she will cover some household costs in order to continue offering her family and, especially, her son the necessary conditions for development.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SOFT DRINKS AND INGREDIENTS TO PREPARE FOOD TO SELL

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde is 39 years old and the mother of two children. She owns a restaurant business offering services in a location which is very favorable for most of her clients. She has been in this business for about nine years. She says the only challenge she faces in her business is insufficient capital to expand the business, though her customers always cherish and commend her for the food. She hopes to own a big restaurant in the future. She needs a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and other necessary items to prepare well presented food to sell and attract more customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and other necessary items to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es:
La señora SARA MARIA A. S. tiene 42años, vive en el distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú y pertenece al Banco Comunal NUEVA ESPERANZA. 
La socia presenta estudios secundarios completos, es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 4 dependen económicamente de ella. 
María se dedica a la venta de arroz, gaseosa, leche, golosinas, fideos, menestras, fideos, leche, etc. en la tienda que funciona desde su casa y con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò productos para abastecerla como: arroz, azúcar, leche, golosinas, aceite, fideos, menestras, etc. 
En la actualidad solicitarà un crédito de 1,500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà un mototaxi para darlo en alquiler y así generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
Ella sueña con tener una flota de mototaxis.
texts.en:
Sara María A. Sanches is 42 and lives in the Esperanza District, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad, Peru. She is a member of the "Nueva Esperanza" Village Bank. She has a secondary school education, and has a common law husband and five children, four of whom are dependent on her. María earns her living selling rice, soft drinks, milk, candies, noodles, vegetables for stew, etc., from a store she runs in her house. She used her first loan, for 300 soles, to buy products to stock her store, including rice, sugar, milk, candies, oil, noodles, vegetables, etc. She is currently seeking a loan for 1500 soles so she can buy a moto-taxi to rent out and earn more income for her family. Her dream is to have a fleet of moto-taxis.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a moto-taxi

loans.name: Gianina

texts.es:
Gianina es una mujer dinámica y emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 29 años, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad y junto con su esposo se dedica a la venta de condimentos al por mayor los que son distribuidos en mercados y bodegas de esta ciudad.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Libertadoras” desde hace cuatro años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles lo que le permitió empezar con el negocio de condimentos.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 2200.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà condimentos(comino, ají panca, pimienta, etc) en la ciudad de Lima y posteriormente distribuirà en su ciudad.
La meta de Gianina es tener un local propio en el mercado para vender estos productos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Gianina is a dynamic and enterprising woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 29 years old and the mother of two young children. She and her husband work together selling spices to markets and shops in their city.

Gianina became a member of the “Las Libertadoras” (“Liberators”) Communal Bank four years ago. The first loan that she received was for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles, which enabled her to start her spice business. She is currently requesting a loan for 2,200 nuevos soles with which she will purchase spices (cumin, chili pepper, black pepper, etc.) in Lima to later sell in her city.

Gianina's goal is to have her own stall in the market to sell her products and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use this loan to purchase spices (cumin, chili pepper, black pepper, etc.) in Lima to sell in Pucallpa.

loans.name: Morka

texts.en: Morka sells garri (cassava flakes) at retail prices to her customers in the market. She is married with a child who is still dependent upon her and who goes to school. Morka is a hard working woman; she hopes for a bigger stall in the future. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more garri to sell. She is a committed LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more garri (cassava flakes) to sell

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesús Group

texts.en:
The loan for this committee will be used to purchase clothing and lingerie for subsequent resale; to buy milk, herbs, sugar, oil, flour - all ingredients for pastries; meat, chicken, cassava, fruits - all in bulk for subsequent resale or for cooking; and selling baked goods and ready prepared food.

The committee Divino Niño Jesús was founded when women from a committee in their neighborhood told their friends about the Female Entrepreneurship program. Edith B. sells groceries. M. Librada sells groceries. Dominga G. sells groceries. Gladys R. sells clothing. Digna F. sells fruits and vegetables. Lorenza O. sells roasted chicken. Bernarda D. sells ice cream. Brigida M. sells groceries. Leticia C. sells furniture. Angela M. makes and sells fruit salads. Gladys B. sells groceries. Juana B. makes and sells fruit salads. M. Heriberta sells groceries. Patricia V. sells groceries. Luz O. sells fruit. Carmen V. sells haberdashery. Julia A. sells groceries. Teresita V. sells groceries. Lucia Nuñez sells lingerie. Isabel F. sells groceries.

loans.use: Merchandise and foodstuffs

loans.name: Nelson Francisco

texts.es:
A la edad de 28 años, el caballero Nelson Pérez se dedica a trabajar arduamente con el fin de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación donde tiene que mantener a su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus dos hijos.

Actualmente se desempeña como guarda de seguridad en una empresa y se ha destacado por ser un padre ejemplar ya que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus hijos y ha logrado llevar el sustento a su mesa beneficiando a su familia con el alimento y a sus hijos con el estudio.

El crédito solicitado será invertido para gastos de la promoción de su pequeña hija ya que en estos días estará celebrando esta actividad porque su hija ha cursado satisfactoriamente su año escolar destacándose como muy buena alumna y es su responsabilidad apoyarle en la promoción en su escuela. 
Es por esta razón que espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito le será otorgado satisfactoriamente por la institución y así logrará el sueño de que su hija se promocione de la escuela.
texts.en:
At 28 years of age, Nelson Pérez strives to work hard in order to support his household, which consists of his wife and two children.

He currently works for a company as a security guard. Nelson has been highlighted as an exemplary father who is concerned about the wellbeing of his children. He has managed to provide food on the table for his family and give his children the chance to study.

The requested loan will be used to pay for the promotion expenses of his young daughter. Within the next few days, his family will be celebrating his daughter’s successful completion of another school year. She has stood out as a very good student and it is Nelson’s responsibility to provide for her school promotion. He is confident that this loan will be granted by the Institution so that he can achieve his dream of seeing his daughter promoted at school.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cover the expenses related to his daughter's school promotion

loans.name: Evila

texts.es:
Evila es una mujer trabajadora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 53 años, es madre de  tres hijos  mayores de edad y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es mecànico de motos.
Se dedica a la venta de productos de lencería y forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Tigresas” desde hace cuatro años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò algunas prendas interiores.
Actualmente necesita 800.00 nuevos soles los que utilizarà en la compra de granos de cacao que posteriormente serán vendidos en el mercado de Bellavista de su localidad. 
La meta de Evila es tener una tienda de repuestos y lubricantes de autos y motocar.
texts.en:
Evila is a hardworking and active woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 53 years old, the mother of three adult children and counts on the support of her husband, who is an automobile mechanic.

She sells lingerie and has been a member of “Las Tigresas” (“The Tigresses”) Community Bank for four years. The first loan she received was for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles, which she used to purchase undergarments. She is currently requesting a loan for 800 nuevos soles to purchase cacao seeds which she will later sell in Pucallpa's Bellavista market.

Evila's goal is to have a shop selling spare parts and oil for cars and scooters.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cacao seeds

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora OFELIA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco, Departamento del Cusco. Es Casada, tiene 28 años y es madre de una hija. Mariana tiene cinco años y esta en el jardín. Nuestra socia tiene seis meses de embarazo. 

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de productos de belleza con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario le hacen pedidos porque en ella encuentran una variedad de cosméticos y personalmente les atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más cosméticos de la empresa “ESIKA” como perfumes, collares y pulseras pues en esta época del año es cuando más se vende.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sra. Ofelia is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Luz del Mañana” (New Light of Tomorrow), which is part of Asociación Arariwa in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco. She is 28 years old, married, and the mother of a 5 year old daughter named Mariana who attends kindergarten. Ofelia is also six months pregnant.

Motivated by her personality and desire to fulfill her dreams, Ofelia started a business selling beauty products. She has been gaining customers from the beginning and her earnings allow her to provide for her household. Ofelia provides a variety of cosmetics, so she receives orders on a daily basis from her regular customers. She personally attends to each individual with her charismatic personality. Ofelia has been in this business for several years and has done very well as a result of all the effort she puts into her work. She is a hardworking mother and entrepreneur who succeeds on behalf of her family despite facing adversity. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more products for her ESIKA cosmetics business such as perfumes, necklaces, and bracelets for this time of year when her sales are at their highest.

Ofelia is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ESIKA brand cosmetics & jewelry

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero sells plantains and melons at retail prices. She has been in this business for a long time. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make greater profits. Her husband is a retired civil servant. She is 50 years old and married with five children. She sells for long hours to enable her put food on the table to feed her family members. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more plantains and melons to sell. Vero is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more plantains and melons to sell

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María es una mujer dinámica y perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 47 años, es madre de 8 hijos (5 de ellos son mayores) y cuenta con el  apoyo de su esposo quien es constructor civil.
Ana Marìa se dedica a la venta de pollos y forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace cuatro años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò bebidas como gaseosas y refrescos para luego vender en su casa.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 600.00 nuevos soles los que utilizarà en la compra de pollos  que posteriormente serán vendidos en fiestas navideñas. 
La meta de Ana María es tener un galpón (criadero grande) de pollos y seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana María is a dynamic and perseverant woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 47 years old, the mother of 8 children (5 of whom are adults), and has financial support from her husband, who works in construction.

Ana Marìa sells chicken and has been a part of the “Madres Corajes” (“Courageous Mothers”) Communal Bank for four years. The first loan that she received was for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles, which she used to purchase soft drinks and other refreshments to sell from her home. She is currently requesting a loan for 600 nuevos soles to purchase chickens to sell during the Christmas season.

Ana María's goal is to have a shed to raise chickens and thereby advance her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens to sell during the Christmas season

loans.name: Margarita Esperanza

texts.es: La señora Margarita Esperanza P. S.  es de 24 años de edad, casada vive con su esposo y tiene un hijo ella reside en el lugar conocido como Paraje Pacoc, del Cantón Xantún, municipio y departamento de Totonicapán Guatemala C.A. actualmente ella se dedica prestando sus servicios como Maestra de Educación Primaria según su necesidad ella se acerco a las instalaciones de la Asociación ASDIR para poder adquirir un préstamo debido a sus ingresos que no son suficientes ella desea obtener una computadora portátil así poder mejorar y facilitar su trabajo así poder dar un mejor servicio en su área de trabajo, y su comunidad mejorando a un más sus ingresos mensuales para obtener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Margarita Esperanza P. S. is 24 years old and married. She and her husband have one child. They live in the place known as Paraje Pacoc in the district of Xantún, which is part of the town and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala, Central America.

Margarita currently serves as an elementary school teacher. She has approached Asociación ASDIR to obtain a loan because she does not have sufficient income to purchase a laptop computer. This will help improve and facilitate her work, enable her to provide better service at her job and to her community, and allow her to increase her monthly income for a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a laptop computer

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa D. Lima - Juli” desD. hace 15 años atrás, del distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chucuito, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 55 años D. edad, cunta con estudios primarios completos, es casada y tiene 8 hijos (1 D. ellos vive con ella y 7 tienen familia).
Antonia se dedica a la artesanìa y paralelamente da pensiòn en su casa y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà bayeta y lana.
Su sueño para el futuro es ayudar a sus hijos a poner una tienda D. artesanías. 
Lo que màs le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
For fifteen years, Antonia has been a member of the “Santa Rosa D. Lima - Juli” Communal Bank in the Juli disctrict of Chucuito province in the Puno region. She is 55 years old, married, finished her primary education, and has 8 children (one of whom lives with her and seven who have their own families).

Antonia makes handicrafts and also rents out rooms in her home. She reports that she used her first loan from Manuela Ramos (for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles) as working capital. She is currently requesting a loan for 500 nuevos soles to purchase cloth and wool.

Her dream for the future is to help her children and to open a handicrafts store.

Her favorite things about participating in her communal bank are saving money and meeting with other members.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cloth and wool

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es:
En el departamento de Estelí, la señora Salvadora R. con mucha dedicación ha laborado arduamente para llevar el sustento a su hogar el cual está compuesto por su pequeño hijo al que tiene que brindarle los estudios ya que está en edad escolar y ella es una dama soltera y con la responsabilidad de mantener a este pequeño.

A sus 46 años, ha logrado llevar el sustento  a su hogar y destacarse como una mujer trabajadora que a pesar de las dificultades económicas que atraviesa, siempre está dirigiendo su hogar con responsabilidad. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos para luego ofrecerlos a los posibles clientes porque piensa que con estas ventas que haga logrará solventar algunas necesidades del hogar para continuar brindándole  a su hijo un techo digno que preste las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo como persona y un lugar seguro donde poder habitar.
texts.en:
In the department of Estelí, Sra. Salvadora R. works hard and with great dedication to provide a home for her young son and give him an opportunity for an education since he is of school age. She is a single mother and bears the responsibility of supporting her young child.

At 46 years of age, Salvadora has managed to maintain her home and be a working mother despite facing financial difficulties. She has always conducted herself responsibly as the head of her household. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cosmetics to sell to prospective customers. Salvadora believes these sales will help her cover a few household necessities. As a result, she will be able to provide a decent and safe home for her son and give him the necessary conditions to develop as a person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
La señora Eva es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli” desde hace 11 años atrás, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 49 años de edad, cuenta con estudios primarios completos, es casada y tiene 7 hijos que están casados.
Eva se dedica a la venta de combustible y paralelamente a venta de artesanìa. Nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró lana.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar combustible.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda de combustibles. 
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones en las cuales las socias son muy puntuales .
texts.en:
For eleven years, Eva has been a member of the “Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli” Communal Bank in the Juli district of Chucuito province in the Puno region. She is 49 years old, married, has 7 married children, and completed her primary education.

Eva sells fuel as well as handicrafts. She reports that she used her first loan from Manuela Ramos (for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles) to purchase wool. She is currently requesting a loan for 700 nuevos soles to purchase fuel. Her dream for the future is to have a gas station.

Her favorite things about participating in her communal bank are attending meetings (where the members are always punctual) and learning to save money.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase gasoline and kerosene

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.en:
The loan for this committee will be used to purchase clothing and lingerie for subsequent resale; to buy milk, herbs, sugar, oil, flour - all ingredients for pastries; meat, chicken, cassava, fruits - all in bulk for subsequent resale or for cooking; and selling baked goods and ready prepared food.

The committee "La Esperanza" was formed when there was such great interest to participate in the Female Entrepreneurship program, that there was not enough space in other committees for all the women who wanted to get involved. La Esperanza was formed by a group of passionate and hard-working women dedicated to improving their livelihoods.

Nora S. runs a massage salon. Angelica P. sells groceries. Ada M. sells fruit. Araceli Fariña sells groceries. Juliana V. sells fruit. O. Cross Ma sells fruit. Marta Lagraña owns and runs a pantry. Maria Teresa S. sells candy. Tomasa R. sells groceries. Silvia F. sells fruit. Teresa R. sells groceries. Lidia F. sells groceries. Petrona G. sells vegetables. Cristina B. sells groceries. Ada M. sells fruit. A. Myrian trades goods. P. Fermina sells cleaning products. T. Lidia trades goods. Mirian Peña sells groceries.

loans.use: Merchandise and foodstuffs

loans.name: David Guadalupe

texts.es: El Joven David Guadalupe T. cuanta con 19 años de edad soltero reside en el lugar conocido como caserío Tzan Nimasac, Municipio y departamento de Totonicapán  Guatemala C.A. en la actualidad está prestando su servicios como albañil desde hace ya cinco años por la necesidad y los bajos ingresos que está obteniendo no son suficientes para adquirir más herramientas por lo que se acerco a las oficinas de la Asociación ASDIR para adquirir un préstamo para la compra de una herramienta para mejorar su trabajo, obteniendo así mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
David Guadalupe T. is a single young man who is 19 years of age and lives in the village known as Tzan Nimasac, which is part of the town and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala, Central America. He currently offers his services as a bricklayer and has been doing this type of work for five years. His income is not sufficient to purchase more tools necessary to perform his job. For this reason, he went to the offices of Asociación ASDIR to obtain a loan so that he can purchase these tools to improve his work, increase his income, and provide his family with a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools for performing masonry work

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing, 40, sells melons at retail prices and has been in this business for a long time. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profits.  Her profits from her business feed her family.  Blessing is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more melon to sell.  Her husband is a blacksmith. She is married with four children.  She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more melon to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Obreras Group

texts.es:
Después de haberse capacitado  durante tres días las integrantes del grupo Mujeres Obreras, están preparando su solicitud para acceder al préstamo, liderizadas por su mesa directiva tienen como presidenta a Catalina A., Tesorera es Francisca P. y Secretaria de Actas es Sandra A.,  todas elaboran su reglamento interno de la Asociación quienes se reunirán cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal Los Andes. 
Todas las integrantes tienen sus propios negocios como la costura de prendas de vestir, tejido de aguayo (mantel nativo y colorido), bordado de mantas, venta de lana, velas, ropa, herrería, carpintería, atención de tienda de barrio y venta de comida. Necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería en el caso de negocios de comercialización, compra de materia prima para las que se dedican a la producción.
texts.en:
After having prepared themselves for three days, the members of the “Working Women” group are readying their request to access a loan. They are led by their board of directors: Catalina A., president; Francisca P., treasurer; and secretary Sandra A.. They all work together to make up the internal rules of the Association, which meets every two weeks in Los Andes. All the members have their own businesses, such as seamstresses, knitting of aguayos (a regional, colorful cloth), embroidery, selling yarn, candles, clothes, hardware items, carpentry supplies, neighborhood stores, and food sales. Those that are merchants need the loan funds to buy more product. Those that dedicate themselves to production, need the funds to buy raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and merchandise.

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
Fidelia es una socia dinámica, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 38 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos(1 de ellos mayor de edad) y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la extracciòn de madera. 
Fidelia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, por lo que compra los productos y posteriormente distribuye en los caseríos alejados de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Perlas de Pucallpa” desde hace cinco años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò cajas de gaseosas para venderlas.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 600.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de productos como: arroz, leche, azúcar, fideos, etc. para poesteriormente venderlas. 
La meta de Fidelia es tener un local estable de abarrotes y productos en general.
texts.en:
Fidelia is a dynamic member of her community bank; she lives in the Yarina Cocha district in the region of Ucayali. She is 38 years old, the mother of two children (one of them is an adult), and has the support of her husband who works in logging. Fidelia sells groceries, so she buys products and later distributes them in the villages outside the city of Pucallpa. She has been a member of the "Perlas de Pucallpa" Community Bank for five years, and her first loan was for 300 soles to buy carton of soft drinks to sell. Now, she is requesting a loan for 600 soles that she will use to buy products such as rice, milk, sugar, pasta, etc. to sell. Fidelia's goal is to have a permanent grocery and general store.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Nike

texts.en: Nike (right half of photo) sells and repairs electronics like radios, blenders, televisions, microwaves, etc. She is 32 years old and married with a child.  Her husband runs the business with her, since 2004.  Nike is the leader of Glorious Union. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to add to her business capital and to purchase more electronics to sell. She is grateful to all Kiva lender for their support.

loans.use: Purchase more electronics to sell.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn V., 39, is from Brgy Balaring, Silay City, Negros Occidental. She is married to Edwin an auto diesel mechanic. They have two children who are five and 12 years old.  The older child attends school. 

She dreams to improving her business so she can help her husband earn their livelihood and to send their children to school. In 1990 Ronalyn started making embroidered pillows, bags and other products.  She enjoyed her business and is very skillful in machine embroidery.  As she became known for the quality of her work, her customer-base grew.  It became apparent that she needed more capital to fill orders from her growing clientele. This is why she joined the NWTF Project Dungganon in 2002.  Ronalyn is happy because she is doing something that she loves while earning additional income of at least PHP 2,500 a month.

Ronalyn's Previous loan of Php 19,500 was used as additional capital for her business. Because she used the loan wisely in her business, she was able to pay off her weekly installments on time until she paid the loan in full.  Now for her 15th cycle loan, she wants to borrow another PHP 19,500 so she can continue her embroidery business.
 -------------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros  Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the  lives of thousands of women through Project  <i>Dungganon</i> (a Hiligaynon word that means  <u>Honorable</u>). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is  empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to  achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a  life path that will ultimately make them <i>Dungganon</i> -  a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has  earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: José Marcelino

texts.es:
En el departamento de Estelí, el señor José Marcelino D. se ha dedicado a trabajar muy arduamente ya que es cabeza de hogar y padre de familia de un hijo en edad escolar y que tiene el deber de cuidar de él y brindarle las condiciones necesarias para sus estudios.

El crédito lo solicita porque desea comprar una paca de ropa para comercializarla ya que piensa que comprando esto logrará vender toda la ropa tanto a damas, caballeros y niños y así obtendrá ingresos por utilizarlos en el mejoramiento del nivel de vida de su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo. 

Espera que su crédito sea otorgado muy prontamente y así continuar en el desarrollo de su familia a la que tanto ama.
texts.en:
In the Department of Estelí, Mr. José Marcelino has dedicated himself to working hard. He is head of a family and father of a school-age son he is obliged to care for, providing the necessary conditions for his studies.

The loan José solicits is to buy a pack of clothing to sell. He believes he can sell this, for women, men, and children, and thus obtain income to utilize in improving the living standards of the family that requires his help.

He hopes that the loan may be granted very quickly so he can continue to advance the family that he loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A PACK OF CLOTHING TO SELL

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
La señora CORNELIA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco, Departamento del Cusco. Es Casada, tiene 56 años y es madre de seis hijos, tres aun están bajo su poder. Rildo tiene 22 años y Juan cesar estudian la carrera profesional de Turismo y Richi tiene 25 años y estudia para chef.
 
Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de pollipapas (comida peruana que consta de papas y un trozo de pollo) con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su inicio que empezó con 200 nuevos soles de ganancia hasta la fecha ha ido ganando 400 nuevos soles diarios. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a consumir a su polleria que personalmente les atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades. La socia requiere el préstamo para abrir una brosteria pues en esta época del año es cuando más se vende comida como pollo broster.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Señora Cornelia is a member of the communal bank "Nueva Luz del Mañana," which is part of the Arariwa Association located in Cusco province, in the provincial department of Cusco. She is married, 56 years old, and is the mother of 6 children, 3 of whom are still in her care. Rildo (22), and Juan Cesar are studying to earn professional degrees in tourism, and Richi (25) is studying to become a chef. Her character and her desire to fulfill her dreams motivated her to start her own business selling pollipapas (a Peruvian meal consisting of potatoes and a piece of chicken), the proceeds of which would contribute to the family's income. At the start her earnings were 200 nuevos soles, but currently she has been earning 400 nuevos soles per day. She now has regular customers who turn up daily to consume her chicken meals, and she personally attends to them with her characteristic charisma. She has already had this business for some years now and it has gone very well thanks to all of the effort that she puts into her work. She is a hardworking and enterprising mother who strives to advance her family in spite of adversity. She needs a loan to open a brosteria (a fast food business offering fried chicken and other dishes), as this is the time of year when food such as fried chicken is high in demand. Cornelia is very grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and as such promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to open a brosteria (fast food business offering roasted chicken and other dishes)

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.en:
The loan for the group San Antonio will be used to purchase clothing and lingerie for subsequent resale.  Other loans will cover the cost of acquiring, milk, herbs, sugar, oil, flour, ingredients for pastries, meat, chicken, cassava, fruits, all in bulk to resell.  Some raw materials will be cooked and packaged to resell to customers.

The group was formed by women who share a common goal and vision of working hard to generate more income to support their families and homes. 

Laura A. sells meat. 
Yolanda C. sells milk. 
Gloria G. sells groceries. 
Julia L. sells clothing. 
F. Ermida Merceria
V. Prisciliana sells fruit. 
Cynthia V. sells fruits and vegetables
Miguela M. sells groceries.
Maria Elizabeth Z. Merceria
Pasmore Aniane sells vegetable
Lourdes M. sells fruit
 Maria Graciela M. sells haberdashery
G. Petronita sells fruits and vegetables
G. Marciana sells groceries.
Agustina G. sells fruits.
Ramona Cañiza sells fruits and vegetables
Leticia Cañiza sells fruits and vegetables
Ines B. sells groceries.
Narcisa A. sells meat.
Librada M. owns and operates a pantry.
Joaquina T. sells home-products and merchandise. 
Emilia L. sells groceries.

loans.use: Buy merchandise and foodstuff to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 38 años, es madre de cuatro hijos (2 mayores de edad), es casada y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es agricultor.
Ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde su casa, por tal debe levantarse temprano y preparar los platos que ofrece a sus clientes (caldo de gallina, tallarines, asado de pollo, lomo saltado).
Carmen forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” desde hace dos años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos con los que comprò productos de belleza para vender.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 1400.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados para implementar su pequeño restaurante(compra de sillas, mesas, platos, manteles)y a la vez para comprar productos para el restaurante(aceite, arroz, azúcar, etc). 
La meta de Carmen es tener un restaurante màs grande y una tienda de abarrotes en general(venta al por menor).
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a dynamic hard working woman. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district of the Ucayali region. She is 38 years old and the mother of four children (2 are adults). She is married and depends on her husband who is a farmer. She sells food from her home and she must get up early every day to prepare the dishes that she sells to her customers (chicken soup, noodles, grilled chicken, meat stew). Carmen has been a part of the "Las Rosas" communal bank for the past two years. She used her first loan of 300 PEN to invest in beauty supplies for resale. She is asking for a loan of 1400 PEN ($500) to start a small restaurant (buy chairs, tables, plates, tablecloths) and also to invest in supplies (cooking oil, rice, sugar, etc.). Carmen's goal is to have a larger restaurant and a small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restaurant furniture and supplies.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort, 50, sells melon at retail prices. She has been in this business for a long time. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profits. Her husband is a commercial driver. She is married with five children.  She sells for long hours to put food on her table to feed her family.  Comfort is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more melon to sell.  She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more melon to sell.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es una socia dinámica, vive en el distrito de Campo Verde, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 26 años y se dedica a la venta de menús desde hace dos años, actividad que realiza junto a su mamá.
Forma parte del Banco comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace un año y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles  los que invirtió en productos para su restaurante.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 1200.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà sillas, mesas y una refrigeradora de segundo uso. 
La meta de Luz es tener una fuente de soda e implementar su restaurante.
texts.en:
Luz is a dynamic partner who lives in the district of Campo Verde, in the region of Ucayali. She is 26 years old and has made a living for two years selling food, alongside her mother. She has been a part of the communal bank "Las Nazarenas" for a year, and the first credit that she received was 300.00 nuevos soles, which she invested in products for her restaurant. Currently she needs a loan of 1200.00 nuevos soles with which she will purchase chairs, tables, and a second-hand refrigerator. Luz's goal is to have a soda fountain and set up her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chairs, tables, and a second-hand refrigerator for her restaurant

loans.name: Llenci

texts.es:
Llenci es una mujer trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 58 años de edad y es madre de tres hijos todos mayores de edad.
Llenci se dedica a la venta de frutas en el puerto de este distrito, actividad que realiza todos los días. 
Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Fresitas” y actualmente necesita un crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà frutas al por mayor. 
La meta de Llenci es tener una tienda bien surtida de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Llenci is a hard-working woman who lives in the district of Yarina Cocha, in the Ucayali region. She is 58 years old and is the mother of three children, all of them adults. Llenci makes a living selling fruits in the port of her district, an activity that she does every day. She is a part of the communal bank "Las Fresitas", and currently she needs a loan of 300.00 nuevos soles with which she will purchase fruit whole-sale. Llenci's goal is to have a well-stocked grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit whole-sale

loans.name: Ninda

texts.en:
If you have survived hardship in your life, you would never want your loved ones to experience the same difficulties if it were within your power to save them from such an experience. At 61 years old, Ninda E. lives in Purok Paraiso, a neighborhood of Barangay Taloc in Bago City, located in Negros Occidental Province on the Western Visayas islands. She and her husband, Antonio, are still working hard to improve the quality of their family’s life.

Antonio works as a rice farm laborer. This was his source of income when he and Ninda were married and started their family. Back then with four young children, they found themselves in dire straits living well below the poverty line, sometimes having no food to feed their children. It was then that Ninda became determined to raise her children's quality of life by earning her own income to help her husband support their family.

In 2000, she decided to try her luck and applied to join NWTF Project Dungganon so that she could get good business advice and guidance if she were accepted as a member. She passed all the necessary requirements, and with her first loan she built a sari-sari (general store) adjacent to their house. Once she had saved up enough, she widened the variety of goods she sold in her store. With the help of her income from her general store, Ninda's children were able to go to school and finish their college education. Presently NInda earns a minimum monthly income of 3,750 PHP.

Now Ninda is requesting a loan of 19,500 PHP to purchase additional products to sell in her general store. Her previous loan, also 19,500 PHP, was fully utilized as additional working capital for her general store. She paid her installments every week and fully paid off the loan within its term.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital for her sari-sari.

loans.name: Kanayo

texts.en:
Kanayo O. is thirty years old and single without children. He sells bags of melons to make a living. He works for long hours to enable him to put food on his table to feed his aged parents. He is a focused, hard worker. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

Kanayo is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more bags of melons to sell. He is a client of LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of melons to sell.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
Ligia es una mujer trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 55 años de edad, está separada de su esposo y es madre de tres hijos mayores de edad.
Ligia se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado, actividad que realiza diariamente. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Perlas de Pucallpa” desde hace ocho años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò calzado.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1500.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de prendas de vestir para ser vendidas en el mercado.
El sueño de Ligia es tener un local màs amplio para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ligia is a hard-working woman who lives in the district of Yarina Cocha, in the Ucayali region. She is 55 years old, separated from her husband, and is the mother of three children, all of whom are adults. She makes a living by selling clothing and footwear, which she does daily. For eight years she has been a part of the communal bank "Perlas de Pucallpa", and the first credit that she received was of 300.00 nuevos soles, with which she purchased footwear. Currently she needs a loan of 1500.00 nuevos soles, which will be used in the purchase of garments to be sold at the market. Ligia's dream is to have a larger place for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase articles of clothing

loans.name: Yuly Marisol

texts.es:
La señora MARISOL, pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco, Departamento del Cusco. Es madre soltera, tiene 35 años y es madre y padre para sus dos hijas. Claudia tiene 17 años y estudia en la universidad Católica de Santa Maria del departamento de Arequipa y Maria José estudia en el jardín y al próximo año estudiara en el colegio Santa Ana del Cusco. 
 
Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de producto sanitarios con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su inicio que empezó hace 4 años atrás hasta la fecha ha ido ganando mas clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a comprar a su tienda y les atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando mas juegos de baños 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. En la foto la socia esta acompañada de su sobrina y de su hija menor.
texts.en:
Señora Marisol is a member of the communal bank "Nueva Luz del Mañana," which is part of the Arariwa Association located in Cusco province, in the provincial department of Cusco. She is a single mother who is 35 years old; she serves as mother and father to her two children. Claudia is 17 years old and studies in the Católica de Santa Maria university in the provincial department of Arequipa. Maria José is in kindergarten and next year will study at the Santa Ana del Cusco school. Marisol's character and desire to accomplish her dreams motivated her to start her own business selling sanitary products, the proceeds of which would contribute to the family's income. Over the 4 years since she started the business she has been gaining customers. Now she has regular customers who come to purchase from her store daily, and she attends to them with characteristic charisma. She has already had the store for some years now and it has gone very well thanks to all of the effort she puts into her work. She is a hardworking and enterprising mother who strives to advance her family in spite of adversity. She needs a loan to increase her working capital that she will use to buy more bathroom sets (sets of decorative items to use in a bathroom - for example, matching toilet cover, bath mat, etc.) She is very grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and as such promises to make her payments on time. In the photo, she is accompanied by her niece and her younger daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bathroom sets (sets of decorative items to use in a bathroom - for example, matching toilet cover, bath mat, etc.)

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel F. es una socia trabajadora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali Ella tiene 61 años, es madre soltera de 7 hijos mayores por quienes se esfuerza dìa a dìa.
Isabel se dedica a la venta de comidas y bebidas, actividad que realiza desde su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace nueve años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles que utilizó en la compra de víveres para preparar comida y luego venderla
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1800.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà vìveres para seguir vendiendo comidas y además comprara gaseosas. 
La meta de Isabel es aumentar sus ventas implementando su negocio.
texts.en:
Isabel F. is a hardworking and active communal bank member who lives in the City of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali Region. She is 61 years old, and a single mother with 7 older children that are the reason she works hard day to day. Isabel sells food and beverages from home. She has been part of the “Las Nazarenas” Communal Bank for the past nine years; the first loan that she received was of 300 PEN, which she used to purchase supplies to prepare and sell food. Currently she needs a loan of 1,800 PEN with which she will purchase supplies to continue preparing and selling food, as well as soft drinks. Isabel’s goals are to increase her sales, and to continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to purchase supplies to be able to continue selling food, as well as to purchase soft drinks.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru I” desD. hace 14 años atrás del distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 54 años D. edad, no cuenta con estudios, es casada y tiene 8 hijos(4 D. ellos viven con ella y los otro 4 son independientes).
Cristina se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado ovino y porcino y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital comprando ovejas y conejos.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con los que podrá comprar màs ganado como vacas y ovejas.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su chacra en Tacna para poder vivir mejor. 
Lo que màs le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Lucia has been a member of the Communal Bank “Tupac Amaru I” for the past 14 years. She is from the Yunguyo District and Province, in the Puno Department. Lucia is 54 years old, does not have any formal schooling, and is married with 8 children (4 of them live with her, and the other 4 are living on their own). Cristina dedicates herself to the purchase and sale of sheep and pigs, and tells us that with the first loan of 300 PEN that she requested through the Manuela Ramos Movement, she was able to increase her capital by purchasing sheep and rabbits. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PEN, which she will use to purchase more cows and sheep. Her dream for her future is to own a plot of land in Tacna to be able to live better. What she most likes about her Communal Bank is saving and the meetings with the other group members.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cows and sheep.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru I” desde hace 14 años atrás del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 60 años de edad, no cuenta con estudios, es viuda y tiene 6 hijos (2 de ellos viven con ella y 4 son independientes).
Sabina se dedica a la compra y venta de frazadas y manà y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital comprando maná y frazadas.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar un toro.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa, comer mejor, y vivir tranquila. 
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Sabina has been a member of the Communal Bank “Tupac Amaru I” for the past 14 years; she is from the Yunguyo District and Province, in the Puno Department. She is 60 years old, does not have any formal schooling, and is a widow with 6 children (2 of them live with her, and 4 are living on their own). Sabina purchases and sells blankets and Peruvian candy, and tells us that with her first loan of 300 PEN that she requested through the Manuela Ramos Movement she was able to purchase blankets and candy. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN with which she will be able to purchase a bull. Her dream for the future is to own a house, eat better, and live peacefully. What Sabina most enjoys about her Communal Bank is saving, and the meetings with other group members.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bull

loans.name: Yoni

texts.es:
La señora YONI, pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco, Departamento del Cusco. Es conviviente, tiene 40 años y es madre de tres hijos. 

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de pollos y gallinas con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su inicio que empezó a vender 10 gallinas o pollos y después vendió 40 o 50 pollos o gallinas hasta la fecha ha ido vendiendo más de 1000 pollos cada 15 días. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a comprar a su tienda y les atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando más pollos o gallinas.  
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ms. Yoni is part of the Communal Bank "Nueva Luz del Mañana" ["Tomorrow's New Light"] from the Arawira Association in the Province of Cuzco, Department of Cuzco. She lives with her life partner, she is 40 years old and is a mother to three children.

Her character and her wish of fulfilling her dreams motivated her to start her own business selling chicken and hens. With the earnings she made she was able to make a contribution to her home's income. At the beginning she sold 10 hens or chickens, later she sold 40 or 50 and nowadays she sells more than 1,000 chickens every 15 days. Today she has stable clients that shop daily in her store, and she serves them with the charisma that is so characteristical of her. Her business has been running for several years and she has done well thanks to the effort she pours into her work. She is a working and enterprising mother that supports her family in spite of adversity. She requires a loan to increase her working capital and purchase more chickens or hens.

She is very thankful for the opportunity offered her through this medium and she is also committed to fulfilling her payments according to the repayment calendar.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens and hens

loans.name: Adita

texts.es:
Adita P. es una mujer dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali. Ella tiene 39 años D. edad, es madre D. cinco hijos (dos mayores)y cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien trabaja en un consorcio.
Adita se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir y forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” donD. se ha caracterizado colaboradora y puntual en sus pagos. El primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300.00 n nuevos soles los que le permitieron invertir en pollos para vender.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito D. 500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà prendas D. vestir y para luego venderlas. 
La meta D. Adita es llegar a tener un negocio bien implementado.
texts.en:
Adita P. is a dynamic and contributing woman who lives in the Pucallpa Region of Ucayali. She is 39 years old and is a mother of 5 children (2 are older). She counts on her husband’s support, who works in a consortium. Adita sells clothing, and is part of the Communal Bank “Las Nazarenas” where she is known for contributing and her punctual payments. The first loan of 300 PEN that she received allowed her to invest in chickens to sell. Currently she needs a loan of 500 PEN which she will use to purchase clothing to later sell. Adita’s goal is to have a well established business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to purchase women and men’s clothing.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
María Angélica es una mujer dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 58 años de edad, es madre de seis hijos y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.
Ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir y paralelamente vende repuestos de motos.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace nueve años donde se ha caracterizado por su puntualidad en los pagos. El primer crédito que recibiò fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que le permitieron invertir en telas e hilos para confeccionar prendas.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà telas, hilos y elásticos para confeccionar blusas y luego venderlos. 
La meta de María es llegar a tener un taller bien implementado y seguir mejorando económicamente.
texts.en:
Maria Angelica is a dynamic and contributing woman who lives in the Pucallpa Region of Ucayali. She is 58 years old, a mother of six children, and counts on the support of her husband. She makes clothing, and concurrently also sells spare parts for motorcycles. She has been part of the Communal Bank “Madres Corajes” for the past nine years, and is known for being punctual in her payments. The first loan that she received of 300 PEN allowed her to invest in fabrics and threads to make her garments. Currently she needs a loan of 300 PEN which she will use to purchase fabrics, threads, and elastic to make blouses that she will later sell. Maria’s goals are have a well established sewing shop, and to continue improving her economic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to purchase fabrics, threads, and elastic to make blouses.

loans.name: Have Faith Group

texts.en:
Konah Dalleh is a leader of a group of five borrowers called Have Faith. She lives and works in the Plum Valley community in Gbarnga, the capital of Bong County, Liberia. She is married with six children ages ten to thirty years old. Her children are not in school due to hardship and poverty. Konah herself is illiterate due to a lack of money.

Konah sells a variety of basic goods. She buys them wholesale and sells them at a fair retail price in order to encourage the residents of her community to continue buying from her. She has been running this business for ten years and hopes to improve her business at a storage center.

Konah faces problems with getting some goods due to her low income. She needs this loan to purchase new goods to improve her business. Konah dreams of sending her children to a good school .

loans.use: To purchase new wholesale goods to sell at retail.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La señora Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru I” desde hace 14 años atrás del distrito  y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno Ella tiene 37 años de edad, no cuenta con estudios, es viuda y tiene 6 hijos.
Maria se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital comprar chuño, habas, cebada, y gaseosas.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà màs mercadería como chuño, habas, cebada, etc.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su carro.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Faustina has been a member of the “Tupac Amaru I” Communal Bank for 14 years. She lives in the district and province of Yunguyo, department of Puno Ella. She is 37 years old, has not been to school, is a widow, and has 6 children.

Faustina’s business is sale of bulk foods. Her first loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos, for 500 soles, was used to purchase potato flour, beans, barley, and soft drinks. She is now seeking a loan for 3000 soles to buy more merchandise. Her dream for the future is to have her own car.

What she likes best about her communal bank are the savings account and the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potato flour, beans, and barley

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La señora SANDRA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco, Departamento del Cusco. Es conviviente, tiene 28 años y es madre de una hija. Su hija Guadalupe tiene 5 años y estudia en el jardín “URPICHA”.    

La socia trabaja en una empresa de cadena de boticas “ALBIS” como vendedora de medicamentos. Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio abriendo su propia botica “LUPITA” donde vende  medicamentos con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a comprar a su tienda y les atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando más medicamentos.  
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra is a member of the Community Bank “Nueva Luz del Mañana” (Tomorrow’s New Light), which is part of the Arariwa Association of the Province and District of Cusco. She lives with her common-law husband; she’s 28 and she has a 5-year-old daughter, Guadalupe, who goes to kindergarten at “Urpicha”. Sandra works at one of “ALBIS” Pharmacy Chain Stores as a sales person. Her character and desire to fulfill her dreams have motivated her to also start her own business, called “Lupita” Pharmacy Store, where she sells prescription drugs, using the money as an extra home income. Since her beginnings she has made more and more customers, some of who have become regulars, going to her store every day, just to receive her candid service. She’s being her own boss for several years now. Her business has been successful thanks to her hard work. Sandra is a working mother and an entrepreneur who is able to support her family in spite of the hard times. She would like to receive this loan to increase her resources by buying more drugs for her store. She is very thankful for the opportunity she has been given through this means and she is also committed to fulfill the payments according to her payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She would like to receive this loan to increase her resources by buying more drugs for her store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa G. es una socia dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 39 años, es madre de cinco hijos y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en el sector salud.
Rosa se dedica a la venta de pollos en el mercado y forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las nazarenas” desde hace trece años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles que utilizó en la compra de pollos para la venta en el mercado. 
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 2000.00 nuevos soles los que le permitiràn continuar con la venta de pollos. 
La meta de Rosa es ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Rosa G. is a dynamic and hardworking member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the region of Ucayali. She is 39 years old, is the mother of five children and has the support of her husband, who works in the health sector. Rosa dedicates herself to selling chickens in the market and has been part of the community bank, "Las nazarenas", for 3 years. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy chickens to sell at the market. Currently, she needs a loan of 2,000 PEN, which will allow her to continue selling chickens. Rosa's goal is to expand her business and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens at wholesale

loans.name: Be Serious Group

texts.en:
Joseph B. M. is a leader of a group of five borrowers called Be Serious. He is single with four children ages two to twelve years old.Their educational levels nursery - 3rd grade. Joseph attended school through the tenth grade but dropped out for lack of financial support. He lives and works in the community of Belefania in Gbarnga, the capital of Bong County, Liberia. Joseph dreams of raising his family in a good way.

Joseph’s business is bicycles. He service and repairs bicycles and has been in business for three years and hopes to own a bicycle shop. He operates on discount in order to attract more customers. The challenge Joseph faces is bad road conditions. He needs this loan to purchase more materials.

loans.use: To buy materials for his bicycle repair business.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina  R., es una socia emprendedora y colaboradora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 23 años de edad, es madre de una pequeña y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es trabajador independiente.
Ella se dedica a la compra y  venta de maderas y forma parte del Banco Comunal “Perlas de Yarina” desde hace cinco años. Karina empezó con un crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles los que utilizò en la compra de golosinas. 
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 3000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà madera para posteriormente venderla.
La meta de Karina  es tener un local propio para la venta de productos comestibles.
texts.en:
