Karina R. is an enterprising and collaborative member. She lives in the district of Yarina Cocha in the region of Ucayali. She is 23 years old and is the mother of a young child. She has the support of her husband who is an independent worker. She dedicates herself to buying and selling wood and has been a part of the community bank, "Perlas de Yarina" ["Pearls of Yarina"], for five years. Karina began with a loan of 300 PEN, which she used to buy sweets [for another project]. Currently, she needs a loan of 3,000 PEN with which she will buy wood to sell. Karina's goal is to have her own store to sell food products.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood to sell

loans.name: Self Help Group

texts.en:
Eddin Brishbana is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Self Help. She lives and works in the community of Belefania in Gbarnga, the capital of Bong County, Liberia. She is single with six children ages three months to sixteen years old; their educational levels range from kindergarten to sixth grade. Eddin attended school through tenth grade but dropped out for lack of financial support. She dreams of sending her children to a better school.

Eddin sells general goods which she buys at wholesale and sells at retail to residents of her community. She sells quality materials in order to attract more customers. She has been in business for four years and hopes business will improve to the point where she can have her own shop.

Eddin faces problems with buying quality goods because of their scarcity. She needs this loan to purchase additional goods.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli” desde hace 5 años atrás, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 49 años de edad, no cuenta con estudios, es casada y tiene 8 hijos (4 de ellos viven con ella y 4 tienen su familia).
Andrea se dedica a la venta de artesanìa y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar los materiales necesarios para hacer las artesanías.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà lana, bayeta y anilima.
Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su alimentación y vivir tranquila. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Andrea has been a member of the community bank "Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli" for 5 years. She is from the district of Juli in the province of Chucuito in the department of Puno. She is 49 years old, has not studied, is married, and has 8 children (4 of whom live with her and 4 of whom have their own family). Andrea dedicates herself to selling handicrafts and tells us that with the first loan of 500 PEN that she requested from the Manuela Ramos Movement, she was able to buy the materials necessary to make the crafts. She is requesting a loan of 500 PEN with which she will buy wool, cloth, and other products. Her dream for the future is to improve her diet and to live peacefully. What she likes most about her community bank are saving and meeting with the members.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool, cloth, and other products

loans.name: Maria Benita

texts.es:
María Benita es una socia dinámica y colaboradora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 48 años, es madre de cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es operador de maquinaria pesada.
Marìa se dedica diariamente a la venta de jugos desde la vereda de su casa y forma parte del Banco  Comunal “Las Fresitas” desde hace ocho años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que pudo comprar telas, elásticos y adornos para vestidos.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 3000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà sillas, mesas y utensilios para implementar su negocio. 
El sueño de María es hacer màs conocido su quiosco de jugos y néctares.
texts.en:
María Benita is a dynamic and collaborative member who lives in the district of Yarina Cocha in the region of Ucayali. She is 48 years old, is the mother of four older children, and has the support of her husband who is an operator of heavy machinery. María dedicates herself every day to selling juices from the sidewalk in front of her house. She has been a part of the community bank "Las Fresitas" for eight years. The first loan the she received was for 300 PEN with which she was able to buy fabrics, elastic, and adornments for dresses. Currently, she needs a loan of 3,000 PEN with which she will buy chairs, tables, and tools to set up her business. María's dream is to make her juice kiosk better known.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, and tools to set up her business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana M., es una socia colaboradora y dinámica, vive en el distrito D. Manantay. Ella tiene 52 años, es madre D. cuatro hijos todos mayores D. edad y cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica a la venta D. pesacado fresco.
Juana se dedica diariamente a la venta D. comidas típicas D. la región (juanes, arroz envuelto en hojas, tacacho, plátano aplastado, patarashca, pescado envuelto en hojas,etc.), actividad que realiza desD. la vereda D. su casa por las tardes y paralelamente alquila un motocar. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Libertadoras” desD. hace tres años y con el primer préstamo que recibió que fue D. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar utensilios y cocina a carbón. 
Actualmente necesita un crédito D. 1200.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà productos como arroz y aceite al por mayor y a la vez repuestos para su motocar. 
La meta D. Juana es seguir trabajando y ayudando a su esposo en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Juana M. is a collaborative and dynamic member. She lives in the Manantay district. She is 52, and she has four grown children. She counts on the support of her husband; he sells fresh fish. Everyday Juana sells food that is typical in her region (“juanes”, rice wrapped in leaves; “tacacho”, smashed plantain; “patarashca”, fish wrapped in leaves; etc.). She does this on the path to her house in the afternoons. She also rents out a “motocar” (three wheeled motorized vehicle). She has been part of the Las Libertadoras Communal Bank for three years. With her first loan for 300 PEN she was able to buy kitchen utensils and coal. She currently needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy wholesale products like rice and oil. She will also buy replacement parts for her motocar. Juana’s goal is to keep working and helping her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food preparation and replacement parts for maintenance on her motocar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy higher quality sheep.

loans.name: Carla

texts.es:
Carla tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo, quien profesor de arte y tienen 2 hijos en edad escolar.
Desde hace 2 años ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos y lo hace con mucha paciencia, para que puedan obtener el peso exacto y lo ofrezca a un precio cómodo.
Cada 45 días, ya están listos para ser vendidos a los compradores regulares que tiene en su zona. Sin embargo, además de esto, Carla también vende comida rápida por las noches (salchipapas y pollos broaster) negocio en el que la va muy bien y lo viene ejerciendo desde hace muy poco tiempo (2 meses). 
Lo más difícil para ella es no contar con un galpón adecuado para sus animales, pues los cría el aire libre dentro de su casa. Su deseo a futuro es tener su restaurante o una pastelería.

Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su grupo e que no tienen problemas de pago y todos son muy puntuales. Lo que Carla necesita es mandar a construir un galpón para sus pollos, por lo que el dinero que ahora solicita lo usará en la compra de materiales de construcción, además de pollos bebés y lo necesario en alimento para su crianza.
texts.en:
Carla is 29 years old. She lives with her husband, who is an art professor and they have 2 children who go to school. Two years ago, she patiently began to breed chicken. With her method, they can gain a nice weight, which allows her to sell them at a fair price. They are ready every 45 days, and she sells them to regular buyers in her area. She also sells fast food at night, (hot dogs and fries and chicken nuggets) and even though she started only 2 months ago, the business is very successful. The hardest part of her business is not to have adequate facilities for her animals, as the breeding process occurs in the open air at her house. Her dream for the future is to open her own restaurant of bakery. This is her 8th loan with MFP and what she likes about her group is that everybody is very responsible with their payments. Carla needs to hire a contractor to build a shed for her chicken. She will use the money she's requesting at this time to buy construction materials, as well as chicks and breeding food.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a chicken shed

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La señora Delia es socia del Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru I” desde hace 9 meses atrás (reingresante) del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 45 años de edad, estudiò primaria incompleta, es casada y tiene 6 hijos (5 de ellos viven con ella y 1 ya tiene su familia).
Delia se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado porcino y ovino y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con los que podrá comprar una vaca lechera.
Su sueño para el futuro es comprarse un carro. 
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Delia has been a member of the “Tupac Amaru I” community bank for the last 9 months (when she rejoined) in the district and province of Yunguyo, department of Puno. She is 45 years old, did not finish primary school, is married, and has 6 children (5 of whom live with her and one who already has their own family). Delia buys and sells pigs and sheep, and she says that with her first 500 soles loan from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos she was able to increase her capital. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles so she can buy a dairy cow. Her future goal is to buy a cart. What she likes best about her Community Banks are the savings and the meeting with the members.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila es una socia dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 39 años, es madre de cuatro hijos(uno menor de edad) y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la pesca.
Domitila se dedica a la venta de golosinas y gaseosas, actividad que realiza desde su casa y forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace ochos meses. El primer crédito que recibiò fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que invirtiò en gaseosas y golosinas para vender.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 700.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà golosinas y a la vez nylon para arreglar la red que utilizan para pescar. 
La meta de Domitila es tener una tienda bien surtida de abarrotes en general.
texts.en:
Domitila is a dynamic member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 39 years old, is the mother of four children (one of which is under 18), she has the support of her husband who works in fishing.

Domitila sells candy and soft drinks, which she does from her home. She has been a member of the “Madres Corajes” communal bank for the past eight months. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which she invested in soft drinks and candy to sell.

She currently needs a loan of 700 PEN, with which she will purchase candy, as well as nylon to fix the net that they use for fishing.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase candy, as well as nylon to fix the net that her husband uses to fish

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina  es socia del Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru I” desde hace 14 años atrás del distrito  y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 48 años de edad, estudiò primaria incompleta, es casada y tiene 6 hijos (2 de ellos están a su lado y 4 viven aparte). 
Cristina se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno y adicionalmente cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes y un kiosco en la escuela de su distrito.Ella nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital.
En la actualidad solicitará un crédito de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar mercadería de abarrotes como fideos, azúcar, arroz, etc.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa en Tacna y poner una tienda. 
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias
texts.en:
Cristina has been a member of the “Tupac Amaru I” communal bank in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the Puno department, for the past 14 years. She is 48 years old, married, and has 6 children (2 live with her and 4 live separately). She completed some of primary school.

Cristina purchases and sells cattle and also has a grocery store and kiosk at the school in her district. She tells us that with her first loan with Movimiento Manuela Ramos, which was for 300 PEN, she was able to increase her capital. She is currently asking for a loan of 3000 PEN with which she will be able to purchase grocery merchandise such as pasta, sugar, rice, etc.

Her dream for the future is to have her house in Tacna and set up a store. What she likes most about her communal bank are the savings and the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, pasta

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora tiene 45 años, es madre de tres hijas que son estudiantes y vive con su esposo, quien es policía. 
Desde hace 19 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes; tales como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, etc., además de golosinas y bebidas. Para ello, ha implementado un espacio para su kiosko al frente de su casa y cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas.
Lo que le gusta de esta actividad es estar en contacto con sus clientes, con quienes comparte muchos diálogos y les da un buen trato. A su vez, este negocio le es muy rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en una muy buena zona y es la única persona que cuenta con este tipo de negocio.
Para más adelante, Dora quisiera tener un minimarket donde pueda ofrecer todo tipo de productos a los habitantes de su localidad.

Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ha tenido buenos comentarios acerca de su banco comunal, además que todos son personas que ella conoce, por lo que está muy contenta de ser parte de ese grupo. Con el dinero que solicita adquirirá más productos comestibles de primera necesidad, golosinas y bebidas gaseosas para seguir surtiendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Dora is 45 years old. She has three daughters who still go to school and she lives with her husband, who’s a police officer. She’s been selling groceries for the last 19 years. Among her items you can find, rice, sugar, beans as well as candy and soft drinks. In order to do so, she uses a room of her house with a window to the street as a small shop which she manages with the support of her daughters. She enjoys this activity because it allows her to be in contact with her customers, sharing nice talks and good service. At the same time, this business is very profitable because she’s located in a good area and she’s the only one who owns this kind of business. In the future, Dora would like to open a minimarket where she could offer all kinds of products of the people of her town. This is the first time she requests for a loan at MFP. She has only good words for her community bank, especially because she knows everybody there and she's very happy to be a part of this group. She will use the money she’s requesting to buy basic food items, candy and soft drinks to restock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia R. es una mujer dinámica y muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 42 años de edad y es madre de tres hijos.
Sonia se dedica diariamente a la venta de panes por lo que cuenta con una panadería en su casa.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace cinco años donde se ha caracterizado por su alegría y las ganas de salir adelante. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que le permitieron invertir en insumos para la elaboraciòn de panes.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 2500.00 nuevos soles  con los que comprarà insumos para la elaboraciòn de panetones. 
La meta de Sonia es ampliar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sonia R. is a dynamic and hardworking woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 42 years old and the mother of three children.

Sonia sells bread on a daily basis, for which she has a baker’s shop in her home. For the past five years, she has been part of the “Madres Corajes” communal bank where she is known for her happiness and desire to succeed. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which allowed her to invest in bread making supplies.

She currently needs a loan of 2500 PEN, with which she will purchase supplies to make panetones (Christmas bread).

Sonia’s goal is to expand her business and provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of supplies to make panetones (Christmas bread)

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana tiene 51 años, es madre de tres hijos que ya son mayores de edad, trabajan y le apoyan en lo posible. Vive con su esposo, quien es mecánico de una empresa de maquinaria pesada (tractores). 
Ella es propietaria de 7 motocarros, los mismos que compró gracias a unos ahorros que tenía guardados y los completó con el apoyo de su  banco comunal. Uno de los motocarros lo maneja su hijo, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, y los demás por choferes particulares.
Eliana adquirió estos vehículos hace 4 años y trabajan con ellos desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche y quien administra las ganancias es Eliana.
Adicionalmente, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, la cual lleva a vender por algunas zonas ribereñas (caseríos). Su próxima meta, es lograr comprar un auto para poder trasladarse con su mercadería y también trabajar con éste.

Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su grupo es que son personas organizadas y se apoyan mutuamente. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará repuestos para mandar a reparar y hacer mantenimiento a sus motocarros, para que trabajen sin problemas.
texts.en:
Eliana is 51 year old. She has three children of age, who work and help her whenever they can. She lives with her husband, who’s a mechanic at a heavy machinery company (tractors). She owns 7 motorcars that she bought with her savings and the support of her community bank. Her son drives one of them. He works are a public transport driver. The rest of the motorcars are worked by private drivers. Eliana bought these vehicles 4 years ago. They’re worked from 6am to 9pm and Eliana manages the profits. Additionally, she sells clothes around the coast area (low-income homes). Her next goal is to buy a car to transport her items and to also work with it. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and what she enjoys the most about her group is that they are very organized and supportive of each other. She will use the money she’s requesting to buy spare parts for the motorcar’s maintenance, so they can work without a problem.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy spare parts for her motorcars

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina lives in Kherson, southern Ukraine. She sells women’s outer clothing in one of the local markets called Dneprovskyi. The location of her vending kiosk is very favorable as it’s in a busy place. Valentina re-stocks her inventory regularly and tries to watch all the new trends in fashion to make sure her assortment of merchandise pleases the different tastes of the women who buy from her.

Valentina has been in this trade for 15 years. She has proven to be an honest and communicative business woman. Presently, she has about 20,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. Her gross income amounts to 15,000 Grivnyas.  

Valentina is hoping to use this loan of 9,720 Grivnyas to increase the variety of inventory in her kiosk and keep her business running successfully this winter season. It’s always harder for entrepreneurs to keep their profits high in winter time. Valentina believes the current loan will assist her in her entrepreneurial endeavors and will help her succeed.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Enith

texts.es:
Enith es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 31 años de edad, se encuentra separada de su esposo y tiene dos hijos menores de edad. Enith se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que realiza desde su casa. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Fresitas” desde hace seis meses y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò productos para cabello.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles que será utilizados en la compra de zapatos para vender por campaña navideña. 
El sueño de Enith es tener una boutique y salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Enith is a dynamic and hardworking woman. She lives in Yarina Cocha district, in the Ucayali region. She is 31 years old. She is separated from her husband and has two young children. Enith sells beauty products from her home. She has been a member of the “Las Fresitas” communal bank for six months. The first loan she received was for PEN 300.00. and with it she bought hair products. She currently needs a loan of PEN 500.00, which will be used to buy shoes to sell during the Christmas shopping season. Enith’s dream is to have a boutique and to get ahead in life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell during the Christmas shopping season

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: A member of LAPO Microfinance, Rachael A. is 34 years old and married with four children. She has been selling cooked foods and drinks for two years now, and one of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. Rachel is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and other items needed to prepare more attractive and continental foods to sell.  She says thank you to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio tiene 65 años, vive junto a su esposa, su hija y su nieta en su casa propia.
Él se dedica a la venta de pan. Su rutina diaria es levantarse muy temprano (4 de la mañana) para acudir a una panadería que se encuentra a dos horas de su casa y es donde se abastece de este producto. Una vez con los panes, los lleva a vender por las distintas zonas de su localidad en su triciclo, el cual es su herramienta de trabajo desde hace 10 años. 
Lo que le gusta a Eusebio de esta labor es dar una buena atención a sus clientes, quienes diariamente esperan “al panadero” nos menciona. Además, le es muy rentable porque ya tiene muchos clientes estables, a quienes no tiene que estar ofreciendo los panes, sino que sólo se encarga de entregarlos en sus domicilios.

Con MFP ya tiene 7 préstamos y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que sus compañeros son personas muy organizadas y sobre todo, responsables con sus pagos. 300 soles de lo que ahora serán destinados a la compra de panes para seguir activo en su negocio, y con lo restante comprará bebidas gaseosas para implementar un pequeño espacio en su casa para la venta de éstas.
texts.en:
Eusebio is 65 years old. He lives with his wife, his daughter and his granddaughter in the house he owns. He sells bread. His daily routine is to get up very early (4 in the morning) to get to a bakery that’s two hours away from his home and where he can buy his items. Once he gets the bread, he sells it on different areas of his town in his tricycle, which has been his work tool for 10 years. What Eusebio enjoys the most about this job is to provide a good service to his customers, who wait for the “baker” every day. This business is also very profitable because he has several regular customers, so he doesn’t have to offer his products, but to deliver them at their door. This is his 7th loan with MFP and what he likes the most about this community bank is that his partners are very organized and, above all, very responsible with their payments. He will use 300 soles to buy more bread and keep his business afloat. The rest will be used to buy soft drinks to open a small sales shop at home.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bread and invest in a new business

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo, quien es policía, y con él tiene 2 hijos que son estudiantes.
Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de comida típica de su región, lo hace los sábados y domingos en su vivienda.
Adicionalmente, ella es profesora de y viene trabajado en un colegio desde hace 10 años; ambos trabajos le gustan mucho porque la hacen sentir activa.
A su vez, la venta de comida le es muy rentable porque su casa está ubicada en una zona bastante transitada, por lo que cuenta con bastantes clientes.
Su deseo a futuro es lograr constituir un restaurante donde pueda vender más platillos y ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y sí le encanta trabajar con su banco comunal porque existe comprensión entre todos, y son muy responsables en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mesas, sillas y mandará a construir un kiosco para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jenny is 37 years old. She lives with her husband, who’s a police office and they have 2 children who go to school. She’s been selling regional food at home for 6 years, on Saturdays and Sundays. She’s also a teacher and she’s worked for the same school for 10 years. She enjoys both jobs because they make her feel active. Food selling is very profitable because her house is located in a very busy area, so she has a lot of customers. Her dream for the future is to open a restaurant to sell more food choices and offer better accommodations for her customers. This is her first loan with MFP and she loves working with her community bank because there’s a great deal of support among the members and they are very responsible with their payments. With the money, she will buy tables and chairs and will hire a contractor to build a small shop to provide a better service for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture and build a shop

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a divorced entrepreneur from Kherson, where she sells women’s clothing at the local markets known as Dneprovskyi. Valentina notes that she is a very disciplined vendor and a borrower. In particular, she explains that she wisely invests her funds and promptly repays her loans. Valentina has been in this trade for seven years. Currently, she has approximately 52,000 Grivnyas (UAH) invested in business, and her gross income amounts to approximately 35,000 Grivnyas (UAH) per month.

Valentina is requesting a loan in the amount of 13,650 Grivnyas (UAH) (i.e., $1,725) to re-stock her inventory and, as a result, boost her sales. She has proven to be a smart, responsible business owner. She hopes that you are willing to take this opportunity to assist her with the ongoing success of her business.

loans.use: To improve her business by increasing her business's inventory

loans.name: Lely

texts.es:
Lely tiene 48 años, es madre de 3 hijos, los mismos que ya son independientes. En la actualidad sólo vive con su esposo, quien es técnico dental.

Desde hace 6 años ella se dedica a confeccionar ropa para niños y adultos, para ello cuenta con un pequeño taller que implementó en su propia casa. Para esta también cuenta con el apoyo de una de sus hijas y lo que más le gusta es que sus clientes confianza en su buena labor y la recomiendan a otras personas. 

Este es su 9no préstamo con MFO, ella es parte de un banco comunal llamado “Trabajando juntos”, y lo que le gusta es que entre todos los integrantes se entienden y hay mucha comunicación. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará telas, hilos y otros materiales para confeccionar más prendas y así seguir activa en esta actividad que tanto le satisface.
texts.en:
Lely is 48 years old and she has 3 children of age. She only lives with her husband, who’s a dental technician. 6 years ago, she began making children and adults clothing. She owns a small work shop located in her house. She also has support from one of the daughters. What she likes the most is to have customers who trust her good work and recommend her to other people. This is her 9th loan with MFO. She’s a member of a community bank called “Trabajando juntos” (Working together). She likes it because members understand each other and have a good relationship. With the money she will buy fabric, thread and other materials to make more items, so as to keep being active in this activity that is so rewarding for her.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase textile materials

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly es una mujer dinámica, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 29 años, es madre de tres hijos menores de edad y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en una farmacia.
Magaly se dedica a la venta de juegos de sàbanas al por menor, actividad que realiza desde hace un año y paralelamente vende productos de belleza, para lo cual debe salir diariamente a ofrecer pues cuenta con una buena cartera de clientes. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” desde hace seis años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò alimento balanceado para pollos para luego venderlos en el mercado; pero que por el momento ha dejado.
Ella necesita un crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà varios juegos de sàbanas. 
La meta de Magaly es tener una tienda de prendas de vestir y artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Magaly is a dynamic woman who lives in the Yarina Cocha district in the region of Ucayali. She is 29 years old, is the mother of three children, and is supported by her husband who works in a farmacy. Magaly sells sets of linens retail and has been doing this work for one year. At the same time, she also sells beauty products, for which she needs to go out every day to sell to her large list of clients. She has been part of the Communal Bank “Las Rosas” for six years. The first loan she solicited was for 300.00 new soles, which she used to buy a specific kind of well-balanced food chickens so that she could later sell them in the market; but she has temporarily left this line of work. She needs a loan of 800.00 new soles in order to buy many sets of linens. Magaly's plan is to eventually open a store to sell clothing and home goods.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy many sets of linens.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz tiene 22 años, es madre de un hijo que tiene 9 meses y vive junto a su pareja, quien es trabajador independiente, y con su hermana en su casa propia.

Desde hace 2 años tiene una pequeña bodega en su vivienda, donde vende abarrotes, comestibles de primera necesidad y bebidas. Luz atiende durante todo el día y le va muy bien porque se encuentra en una zona transitada y concurrida de su localidad.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes, y sentirse activa es lo más importante para ella. A su vez, le es rentable porque sus productos se venden a diario y cuenta con clientes fieles. 
Para más adelante quiere ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en un minimarket donde pueda ofrecer toda clase de productos a sus clientes.

Este es su 3er crédito con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque todos son responsables y trabajadores. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más abarrotes, comestibles de primera necesidad y bebidas gaseosas para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is 22 years old. She has a 9-month baby boy and lives with her common-law husband, who’s a free lance worker, and with her sister in the house she owns. Two years ago, she opened a small shop at home, where she sells groceries, basic food products and soft drinks. Luz works at the shop all day. She has a very successful business because she's located in a very busy area. What she likes the most about her job is to provide a good service for her customers. She also likes to feel active, which is very important to her. At the same time, her business is very profitable because she sells items every day to regular customers. In the future, she would like to expand her business and turn it into a minimarket where she can offer all kinds of products to her customers. This is her 3rd loan with MFP. She’s a member of a community bank and she likes to work with her group because they’re all responsible hard workers. With the money she’s requesting, she will buy more groceries, basic food items and soft drinks to restock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 62 años, es madre soltera; vive con su hija, quien tiene una hermosa pequeña y también está a cargo a  su madre.
Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, lo cuales vende sólo a pedido a través de catálogos, dejándolos al crédito o al contado.
Adicionalmente, cuenta con un motocarro, para el que contrata a chofer quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros y le entrega a ella las ganancias diarias.
A María le gusta mucho su trabajo porque conoce a muchas personas, hace buenas relaciones y sobre todo porque se mantiene activa. 
Para el futuro, desea tener una tienda de zapatos y ropa.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que sus compañeros son personas muy responsables y sobre todo, muy comunicativos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos de belleza y una vitrina para exhibir sus productos y tenerlos mejor protegidos.
texts.en:
María is 62 years old and she’s a single mom. She lives with her daughter, who has a beautiful little girl and she’s also supporting her mother. She began selling beauty products ten years ago. She only sells them through catalog upon request, in cash or credit. She also owns a motorcar, for which she hired a person who works as a public transport driver and gives her all the daily earnings. María enjoys her work very much because she can meet a lot of people and maintain a good relationship with them and because it makes her feel active. In the future, she would like to open a shoes and clothes store. This is her second loan with MFP and what she likes the most about her community bank is that his partners are very responsible and, especially, very open. With the money she’s requesting, she will purchase more beauty products and a display cabinet to show them and keep them better protected.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more beauty products and a display cabinet

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es una socia muy trabajadora y dinámica, vive en el distrito de Campo Verde, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 40 años, es madre de cinco hijos (4 son mayores) y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es agricultor.
Liliana se dedica a la venta de comidas típicas de la región, actividad que realiza por las tardes. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace cinco años y empezó con un crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que pudo comprar productos para su venta.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 3000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà mesas y sillas para brindar una mejor atenciòn al cliente y a su vez comprarà productos al por mayor para su negocio. 
La meta de Liliana es tener un restaurante bien implementado.
texts.en:
Liliana is a very hard-working and dynamic client who lives in the Campo Verde district in the region of Ucayali. She is 40 years old, is the mother of five children (four of whom are grow-up), and she lives with her husband who is a farmer. Liliana's business is the sale of her region's typical food every afternoon. She has been part of the Communal Bank “Las Nazarenas” for five years and started with a loan of 300.00 new soles which she used to buy products to facilitate her sales. She now needs a loan of 3000.00 new soles to be able to buy tables and chairs in order to offer better service to her clients and she will also buy ingredients wholesale for her business. Liliana's goal is to have a well-established business.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use this loan to buy ingredients wholesale for her business.

loans.name: G.s.  Esperanza Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Esperanza. Tiene 2 integrantes por lo que cada una de ellas realiza las mismas actividades económicas. En el caso de Ivon es casada tiene 26 años. Su actividad económica es la venta artesanía. A pesar de lo difícil que es mantener el negocio es una de las mujeres más emprendedoras y dinámicas del grupo.  Su otro socia Flor Dely tiene 29 años. Su actividad económica es venta de artesanía. Ella dio inicio a su negocio con mucho sacrificio y debido a su muy buena administración ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio pues es una mujer muy responsable. Ellas se han unido con el fin de salir adelante, a pesar de que han tenidos muchos desafíos son muy luchadoras y trabajadoras. Por lo que el motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. El sueño de las 2 socias es ayudar a sus familias y además que sus hijos aprendan de sus negocios para que esto les ayude a salir adelante para el día de mañana.
texts.en:
The supportive group Esperanza (Hope) has two members who perform the same activity. 26-years Ivon, is married. She sells handicrafts. Even though it is very hard to keep her business running, she's one of the most hard working and dynamic people in her group. Her partner Flor Dely is 29. She also sells handicrafts. She started her business with a great deal of effort and thanks to her good administration she was able to succeed, as she’s a very responsible woman. They came together in order to succeed, and in spite of several challenges, they are strong fighters and hard workers. They are questing for funding to increase they work capital and to buy raw material. Their dream is to help their families and to transfer their business to their children, to they can use it to support themselves in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Moraima

texts.es:
Moraima tiene 46 años, es madre soltera y vive con uno D. sus tres hijos, quien estudia y le apoya mucho en su negocio.
DesD. hace 4 años se dedica a vender comida (desayuno y almuerzo) en su propia casa, también ofrece a sus clientes bebidas, queques y pan caliente. En todo este tiempo, Moraima ha logrado ganarse la confianza D. todos sus comensales, quienes degustan D. su buena sazón y la recomiendan, pues lo que más importante para ella es dar a sus clientes la mejor atención para que se sientan satisfechos, así como preparar distintos platos para variar cada día.

Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta con su banco comunal porque no tienen problemas y son muy responsables en sus trabajos y en sus pagos. El dinero que esta vez solicita lo invertirá en su negocio D. comida, comprando los comestibles y utensilios necesarios para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Moraima is 46 years old, she is a single mother and she lives with one of her three children. He is going to school and he also helps her a great deal in her business.

For the past 4 years she has been running a breakfast and lunch business from her own home. She also serves drinks, cakes and warm breads. Through all this time she has won over a steady clientele that really enjoys good home cooking, always recommending the restaurant. Her most important goal is to proviD. her clients with only the best customer service so that her clients will feel welcome. She always looks to cook different recipes each day to give some variety.

This is her fifth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy with her community bank because it runs smoothly and they are very responsible in their work and with their payments. The funds that she requests will be invested in her restaurant, to purchase food and new utensils in order to proviD. a better quality of service to her clients.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and utensils for her restaurant.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
Olga Marina es una mujer activa y trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Campo Verde, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 44 años, es madre de tres hijos(dos mayores de edad) y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es agricultor.
Maria se dedica diariamente a la venta de tamales, empanadas y humitas.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace cuatro años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que pudo comprar productos para la preparación de sus alimentos.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà fuentes, mesas, sillas y manteles. 
La meta de Olga Marina es tener un una fuente de soda y su propio local.
texts.en:
Olga Marina is an active and hard-working woman who lives in the Campo Verde district in the region of Ucayali. She is 44 years old, has three children (two of whom are grown-up) and she lives with her husband who is a farmer. Maria sells tamales (a regional dish comprised of dough steamed in either corn or banana leaves), empanadas (stuffed pastries), and humitas (corn paste wrapped in corn leaves). She has been part of the Communal Bank “Las Nazarenas” for four years and her first loan was for 300.00 new soles, which she used to buy the necessary ingredients for her food. She now needs a loan of 800.00 new soles to buy serving dishes, tables, chairs, and tablecloths. Olga Marina's goal is to set up a soda fountain and to own her space.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan to buy serving dishes, tables, chairs, and tablecloths.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 pequeños hijos en la casa de su suegra.
Desde hace 2 años se dedica  a la venta de comida al paso, y todas las tardes sale a vender en la esquina de su casa. Su suegra y su esposo la ayudan en ocasiones a trasladar su carrito sanguchero (móvil para preparar comida), el cual es su principal herramienta de trabajo.
Hace pocos meses Edith dio a luz, por lo que tuvo que dejar de trabajar temporalmente, pero ahora está retornando a su rutina laborar habitual.
Su deseo a futuro es tener un local estable donde pueda ofrecer mayor cantidad de platillos a sus clientes.

Esta es la sexta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y se compromete a seguir siéndolo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mesas y sillas para empezar a implementar su futuro restaurante.
texts.en:
Edith, 27, lives with her husband and two small sons in her mother-in-law's house. For the past two years she has prepared fast-food for sale every afternoon on the corner where she lives. Sometimes her husband and mother-in-law help her move her "sanguchero" (portable food-preparation stand), which is her main work tool, to the location. A few months ago, Edith gave birth so had to stop working temporarily. Now, however, she is restarting her usual work routine. Her wish for the future is to have a stable location where she can offer a greater quantity of dishes to her customers. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She has always made her repayments on time and she pledges to continue to do so. With the funding requested she plans to buy tables and chairs to start to equip her future restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Maday

texts.es:
La señora Maday es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli” desde hace 8 años atrás, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 34 años de edad, cuenta con estdios superiores completos, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo.
Maday se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y artesanìa y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar los materiales necesarios para la elaboraciòn de las artesanías.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 2,300.00 nuevos soles con los que podrá comprar una vaca y un toro.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia y ejercer su profesión. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la puntualidad de las socias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maday has been is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli” for 8 years and lives in the Juli district, Chucuito provinces, Puno department. She is 34 years old, has completed her higher education, is a single mother, and has one son. Maday's business is the purchase and sale of livestock and handicrafts. She tells us that with her first loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos of S/. 300.00 new soles she was able to buy the necessary materials to make her handicrafts. She is seeking a loan of S/. 2,300.00 new soles in order to be able to buy a cow and bull. Her dream for the future is to have her own house and to be able to practice her own profession. The best thing about her Communal Bank is its ability to save and the punctuality of its members.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow and a bull.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en la casa de un familiar.
Desde hace 2 años trabaja junto a su esposo en la elaboración de panes en un horno alquilado. Todas las mañanas, cuando el pan está listo, Marlene recorre los lugares más transitados de su  ciudad ofreciendo sus panes, y es así como cada día se esfuerza para conseguir el sustento familiar. Su habilidad para las ventas ha mejorado notablemente, y también le favorece el delicioso pan que hace con su esposo, por lo que desde tener su propio horno para empezar a producir también pasteles y otros postres.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una nueva integrante en su banco comunal, donde fue invitada a participar por su ser conocida su responsabilidad al trabajar. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará en la compra de harina y los demás ingredientes para elaborar panes y pasteles.
texts.en:
Marlene, 38, lives with her husband and two children in a relative's house. For the past two years she and her husband have baked bread using a leased oven. Every morning, when the bread is ready, Marlene goes to the areas in her city that have the most traffic to offer her bread and this is how she tries to earn her daily sustenance for her family. Her sales abilities have improved considerably and she is also helped by the delicious bread she bakes with her husband. She hopes to have her own oven so that she can begin to produce cakes and other desserts as well. This is her first loan with MFP; she is a new member of a communal bank which invited her to join because of her known work ethic. The funds requested will be used to buy flour and other ingredients needed to bake bread and cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy foour and other bread-baking ingredients.

loans.name: Joanne

texts.es:
Joanne es una socia activa y muy colaboradora, vive en el distrito de Campo Verde, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 40 años y es madre de tres hijos (1 mayor de edad).
Joanne se dedica a la compra y venta de granos (arroz, maíz, etc.) junto a su esposo. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace ocho años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que pudo comprar productos de primera necesidad para vender desde su casa.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 3000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà sacos de arroz y maíz  adquiridos directamente de los agricultores para luego ser vendidos a los molinos. 
La meta de Joanne es dedicarse al engorde de ganados para luego venderlos.
texts.en:
Joanne is a collaborative and active client who lives in the Campo Verde district in the region of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and has three children (one of whom is grown up). Joanne's business is the purchase and sale of grain (rice, corn, etc.) which she runs with her husband. She has been part of the Communal Bank “Las Nazarenas” for eight years and the first loan she received was for 300.00 new soles, which she used to used to buy essential household items to sell from her home. Currently, she needs a loan of 3000.00 new soles in order to buy sacks of rice and corn directly from the farmers in order to later sell them to the mills. Joanne's goal is switch to the business of raising cattle for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan in order to buy sacks of rice and corn directly from the farmers in order to later sell them to the mills.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 20 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en la casa de unos familiares.
Desde hace un año tiene implementó un espacio en su vivienda para la venta de útiles de escritorio y artículos de librería. Raquel atiende todos los días y siempre está pendiente de aquellas cosas que le faltan para implementar su negocio. Y para aprovechar el espacio, también vende algunos adornos y productos de uso personal, pues con la venta de estos objetos mejoró la rentabilidad de su negocio.
Raquel se proyecta para el futuro y lo que desea es trasladarse a un local en una zona más comercial. 

Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería en útiles de escritorio y mercería.
texts.en:
Raquel is 20 years old. She lives with her husband and son in the home of some relatives. A year ago she set up a space in her residence for the sale of office and writing supplies. Raquel works everyday and is always attentive to the things she needs to run her business. In order to take advantage of the space she also sells some ornaments and cosmetics, and with the sale of these items she increased the profitability of her business. Raquel looks to the future and wishes to relocate to a site in a more commercial area. This is the second time she has a loan with MFP and she is very happy to be a part of her communal bank. She will invest the money she is applying for in the purchase of office supplies and sewing supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand inventory

loans.name: Bethi

texts.es:
Bethi es una mujer dinámica y colaboradora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 51 años de edad, es viuda y madre de tres hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes.
Bethi se dedica a la costura y paralelamente a la venta de productos de belleza. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Perlas de Pucallpa” desde hace seis años, tiempo que ha demostrado sus ganas de trabajar y salir adelante. 
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 soles los que utilizò en la compra de blondas, elásticos y telas.
En la actualidad Bethi necesita un crédito de 1700.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà productos de belleza. 
La meta de Bethi es tener una tienda artículos y accesorios para el hogar.
texts.en:
Bethi is a dynamic woman who likes to work together with others. She lives in Yarina Cocha, in the Ucayali region. She is 51 years old, she is a widow, and the mother of three grown children who are no longer dependant on her. Bethi works as a seamstress and also sells beauty products. She has been a member of the “Perlas de Pucallpa” communal bank for six years. During that time she has shown her desire to work hard and get ahead in life. The first loan she received was for PEN 300.00, which she used to buy lace, elastic, and fabrics. Bethi currently needs a loan of PEN 1,700.00, with which she will buy beauty products. Bethi’s goal is to have a store selling household items and accessories for the home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Marita

texts.es:
Marita Z. es una mujer dinámica y colaboradora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 43 años de edad y es madre de tres hijos (2 mayores de edad).
Marita junto a su esposo se dedica a la venta de repuestos y lubricantes para motos y motocar e integra el Banco Comunal “Las Fresitas” desde hace cinco años.
El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles, con los que pudo comprar insumos para la elaboración de panes, actividad que no realiza por ahora.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà repuestos y accesorios de motos. 
El sueño de Marita es implementar su negocio con gran variedad de lubricantes y repuestos para motos y motocar.
texts.en:
Marita Z. is a dynamic and collaborative woman. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district of the Ucayali region. She is 43 years old and the mother of three children (2 of whom are grown). Marita, together with her husband, makes her living selling spare parts and lubricants for motorbikes and motorcars (light-weight 3-wheeled vehicles). She has been a part of the communal bank "Las Fresitas” for 5 years. The first loan she received was for 300.00 new soles, with which she was able to purchase supplies for baking bread, an activity that she is not doing for now. Currently, she needs a loan of 1500.00 new soles with which she will purchase spare parts and accessories for motorbikes. Marita's dream is to set up her business with a great variety of lubricants and spare parts for motorbikes and motorcars.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase motorbike spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Nidia Violeta

texts.es:
La señora Nidia es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” desde hace 5 años, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 23 años de edad, cuenta con estudios superiores incompletos, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo.
Nidia se dedica a la venta de zapatillas y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles con los que podrá comprar más mercadería como zapatilla.
Su sueño para el futuro es abrir un stand de zapatillas.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
For five years now, Señora Nidia has been a member of the Third of May Communal Bank which is in the Llave District, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 23 years old, has some higher education (not completed) and lives with her domestic partner and her son. Nidia works at selling sneakers and she tells us that with the first loan of 300 New Sols which she solicited from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos she was able to increase her working capital. She will now request a loan of 1,000 New Sols with which she will be able to buy more merchandise such as sneakers. Her dream for the future is to open a stand for selling sneakers. The thing she likes best about her Communal Bank is the savings plan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sneakers.

loans.name: Yajaira Melissa

texts.es:
Yajaira es una mujer emprendedora y activa, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 21 años y es madre de dos pequeños.
Yajaira junto a su esposo se dedica a la venta de repuestos y reparación de motos y motocar, pues ambos se han propuesto salir adelante y lograr sus metas. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” hace un año, donde se ha caracterizado por ser una socia puntual. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò lubricantes para motos y motocar. 
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 700.00 nuevos soles que utilizarà en la compra de accesorios de motocar. 
La meta de Yajaira es ampliar su taller de reparación de motos y motocar y de esa manera aumentar sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yajaira is an entrepreneurial and energetic woman. She lives in Yarina Cocha district, in the Ucayali region. She is 21 years old and is the mother of two small children. Yajaira and her husband sell replacement parts and repair motorcycles and motorcycle taxis. Both have decided to get ahead in life and achieve their goals. She has been a part of the “Las Rosas” communal bank for a year, where she has shown herself to be a punctual member. The first loan she received was for PEN 300.00 and she bought lubricants for motorcycles and motorcycle taxis. She currently needs a loan of PEN 700.00, which she will use to buy accessories for motorcycle taxis. Yajaira’s goal is to expand her motorcycle and motorcycle taxi repair shop so she can increase her number of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to buy accessories for motorcycles and motorcycle taxis.

loans.name: Omolele

texts.en:
Omolele, commonly-known as "mummy Kola," is a member of LAPO Microfinance. She is 43 years of age, and she has two children.

To earn a living, she operates a grocery store, where she sells groceries and drinks. She has been running this business for over three years, but she says she now needs additional capital to improve the business. She notes that she is very hardworking and that, as a result of her hard work, she is able to put food on her family's table each and every day. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN ($350) to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional groceries and drinks for resale purposes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joice Mirella

texts.es:
Joice es una mujer dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 23 años, es soltera y hace un año se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y joyas.
Joice forma parte del Banco Comunal “ Las Tigresas” hace dos años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que invirtió en la compra de polos y shorts para la venta.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà joyas. 
La meta de Joice es seguir apoyando a su familia y tener una tienda comercial de artículos de belleza.
texts.en:
Joice is a dynamic woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali Region. She is 23 years old, single and for the last year has been working at selling beauty products and jewelry. For two years now, Joice has belonged to the Las Tigresas (The Tigresses) Communal Bank and the first loan of 300 New Sols which she received was invested in the purchase of polo shirts and shorts for resale. Currently she needs a loan of 500 New Sols with which to buy jewelry. Joice's goal is to continue supporting her family and to have a commercial store for beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Carmen Rosa L. integrante del grupo  Las Emprendedoras que pertenece al Centro Focal Alto Lima, se dedica a la venta D. zapatillas,  en sus inicios ella era vendedora D. zapatillas y con el pasar del tiempo logro abrir su propio negocio, por este fin D. año la venta D. este producto estima que se incrementará por lo que necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería, ella compra sus productos en la Buenos Aires D. la Ciudad D. La Paz y los venD. en la feria 16 D. Julio ambulando (ofreciendo a diferentes personas). Al igual que Carmen sus compañeras tienen diferentes negocios como la venta D. zapatos,  polleras, puertas, transporte  y muebles. Y necesitan el préstamo para comprar productos e insumos.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa L. heads up the “Las Emprendedoras” [Enterprising Women] group of the Alto Lima branch of ProMujer. She sells casual shoes. With time, she has managed to open her own business and at the end of this year she estimates that business will increase so that she will need a loan to purchase more merchandise. She buys her products in La Paz and sells them on foot at the “16th of July” market.

The other members of the group have different businesses, such as sales of shoes, polleras [traditional skirts], doors, transport, and furniture. They also need this loan to buy merchandise and supplies.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products and supplies

loans.name: Wilfredo Antonio

texts.es: Wilfredo Antonio tiene 42 años de edad, este joven tiene 3 hijos de los cuales todos están estudiando y están a su cargo. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, inicio con muy pocos productos a pesar de no tener mucho que ofrecer a sus clientes no ha desistió con seguir adelante con este negocio, el tuvo mucha paciencia pues logro aumentar sus productos y obtener la pulpería en su vivienda, lo más difícil para él es proporcionarle a sus clientes todos los productos que le solicitan. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de juguetes, gaseosas, jugos, pan, y un poco de ropa para niños ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y sus clientes compran sus productos por los ofrece manera favorable. el sueño de este hombre es que su negocio se mantenga y además que sus hijos lleguen a lograr administrarlo.
texts.en:
Wilfredo Antonio, 42, has three school-age children who are all dependent on him and under his care. Wilfredo has a small general store which he began with just a few items. Despite not having much to offer his customers, he persevered. With much patience he managed to increase the variety of his stock items and set up his store in his home. His greatest difficulty is being able to stock everything his customers ask for. The financing he is requesting will be used to buy toys, soft-drinks, juices, bread, and a little bit of clothing for children because the Christmas season is approaching and his customers buy his products because he offers them at reasonable prices. His dream is that his business lasts and that his children run it some day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Rashidat Tolulope

texts.en:
Tolulope is a single, 25-year-old woman. She notes that she is a focused and hard worker.

To earn a living, she owns and operates a hair-dressing business, which offers hair-styling and cosmetics services. Notably, her business is conveniently located near most of her clients. She has been in this business for four years, and she joined LAPO two years ago. She puts in long hours to ensure her business's success. She explains that one of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she has with her customers on a daily basis. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN ($675) to purchase more hair-dressing accessories (e.g., hair extensions) to re-sell to her customers.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional hair accessories for resale purposes

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es:
La señorita Ayde es socia del Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 27 años de edad, cuenta con estudios secundarios completos, es soltera y no tiene hijos.
Ayde se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales y trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 10 días. En su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fue de S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de cereales.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener su capital propio.
Lo que màs le gusta de su organización son los interèses.
texts.en:
Ayde is a member of the Communal Bank "Manuelas de hoy II" and lives in Llave District, El Collao Province, Puno Department. She is 27 years old, has completed her secondary education, is single, and has no children. Ayde buys and sells cereals and has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 10 days. Her first loan in the communal bank was for S/.500.00 nuevo soles, which she used to purchase cereals. Her wish for the future is to have her own capital. What she most likes about her organization is the interest.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potato starch, potatoes, beans, etc

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deisy tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo (Andrés), de 10 años de edad, ellos tienen su casa propia.
Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de comida, ya que desde muy joven ha sido muy  avocada a esta actividad, en la cual se ha se ha caracterizado por tener una buena sazón. Es por ello que decidió tener un negocio propio, pues necesitaba algo que ella pueda realizar desde su casa, porque tener un hijo en edad escolar necesita de mucha atención.
Por tal motivo, esta labor le gusta mucho porque prepara la cantidad exacta de porciones que le solicitan para posteriormente pasar a dejarlos a sus clientes.
Pero por otra parte, es muy sacrificado, pues sus clientes son muy exigentes y debe preparar cada plato con mucha dedicación. 
Para el futuro, Deisy quisiera tener mayor estabilidad con un restaurante donde atender mejor a la clientela.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, ella se considera una persona muy responsable, es por ello que se compromete con cancelar cada una de las cuotas a tiempo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes para preparar más platos, ya que su cantidad de clientes se ha incrementado y espera poder abastecer a todos.
texts.en:
Deisy is 38 years old. She lives with her husband and their 10-year-old son Andres. The have their own house.

For two years, Deisy has had a business selling food. She has been cooking from an early age and is noted for her good taste. It was for this reason that she started her own business. Also, she needed something she could do at home, because raising a school-aged child requires much attention.

She enjoys this work because she prepares the exact quantity of portions that were ordered, then delivers them to the clients. At the same time, it is difficult because the clients are very demanding so she must prepare each dish with real dedication. For the future, Deisy would like to have more stability with a restaurant where she could better serve her clients.

This is Deisy’s first loan with MFP. She is considered a very responsible person and she promises to make each payment on time. With the money from this loan, she will buy a larger quantity of ingredients to prepare more dishes. Her client base has expanded and she wants to satisfy them all.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for food production

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married to a commercial driver in Lagos. She is a 46 years old and is the mother of six children.

Sarah has a store full of foodstuffs and she sells drinks, too. She is over nine years in the business and puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable.

Sarah needs a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to add to her business capital in order to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks in large quantity to sell and attract more customers.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Dionicia tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos: Antoni de 19 y Meli de 4 años de edad. 
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, tiempo en el cual ha ganado mucha experiencia debido a que le dedica buena cantidad de tiempo a su trabajo, con el cual mantiene a su familia. 
A Dionicia le gusta mucho la labor que realiza, ya que le da la libertad de poder atender a su familia mientras obtiene ingresos extras, esto es una gran ventaja porque así no descuida ninguno de estos dos ámbitos. 
Para el futuro espera agrandar su negocio comprando más productos, además de tener una vitrina donde pueda ofrecerlos con mayor comodidad.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y promete ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos de belleza para así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Dionicia, 46, lives with her husband and two children: Antoni, 19 and Meli, 4. For the last 5 years she has sold beauty products. During this time she has gained much experience, thanks to the time she spends dedicated to her work, which allows her to support her family. Dionicia enjoys her work very much because it gives her the freedom to care for her family while earning extra income at the same time. This is a great advantage because it allows her to care for both work and family simultaneously. For the future, she would like to enlarge her business by having more products available and to have a display case where she can offer them more comfortably. This is her first loan with MFP and she promisses to be very punctual with her repayments. With the funds requested she will buy more beauty products to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Vicenta Eliana

texts.es:
La señora Vicenta es socia del Banco Comunal “30 de Agosto”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 42 años de edad, cuenta con estudios secundarios completos, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo.
La señora Vicenta tiene una tienda de abarrotes y trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 11 años atrás. En su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de mercadería.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.1000.00 nuevos soles los que invirtiò en la compra de abarrotes como: fideos, arroz, azúcar, etc.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener una tienda de abarrotes propia, ya que ahora se hace cargo del negocio de su madre.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las charlas que dan las promotoras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vincenta is a partner in the Community Bank of “August 30th”. She lives in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao in the area of Puno. She is 42 years old and has high school studies completed. She is a single mother and has one child. Mrs. Vincenta has a store that sells groceries and she works with the Manueal Ramos Movement for the last 11 years. Her first loan in her Community Bank was for S/300 Peruvian nuevos soles which allowed her to buy the groceries. She is requesting a loan of S/1000.00 nuevos soles which she will invest in the purchase of groceries such as: noodles, rice, sugar etc. Her hope for the future is to have a grocery store of her own, since right now she is in charge of her mother’s store. What she likes the most about her Community Bank are the savings and the lectures that the bank promoters offer.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 54 años, es natural de la ciudad de Ancash (sierra central). Ella vive con sus 2 hijos;  Robert de 11 y Mirella de 16, ya que su esposo falleció hace algunos años.
Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a trabajar, incursionando en variedad de oficios, pero lo que más cómodo y rentable le resultó es la venta de verduras. Y esta actividad la realiza desde hace ya 20 años, tiempo en el que ha ganado experiencia en el comercio y ahora obtiene buenas ganancias, pues Juana tiene mucha empatía con sus clientes y es por eso que se ha convertido en el puesto más concurrido del mercado.
El gran sueño de Juana es agrandar su negocio y poder abrir otro local, así sus clientas se llevarían no solo las mejores verduras, si no también, la mejor atención que se merecen.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y hasta el momento demuestra ser muy responsable. Con el dinero que solicita implementará su negocio con más verduras.
texts.en:
Juana, 54, is from the city of Ancash (central mountain range). She lives with her two children. Robert is 11, and Mirella is 16. Her husband died some years ago. She has worked at various jobs since she was very young. The most comfortable and profitable turned out to be selling vegetables. She has been doing this for 20 years. In that time she has gained experience in the business. Now she gets good earnings. Juana has a lot of empathy for her customers, and that is why her stand is the most popular one in the market. Juana’s big dream is to make her business bigger and to be able to open another location. That way her customers will not only get the best vegetables, but they will also get the best attention that they deserve. This is the first time she has had a loan with MFP. She has shown herself to be very responsible. She will use the money she is asking for to buy more vegetables for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz tiene 45 años, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora; vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 18, 14 y 9 años, en su casa propia.  
Desde hace 10 años se viene dedicando a la venta de comestibles en la bodega que implementó en su vivienda, pues este negocio le da la facilidad de atender su hogar y paralelamente obtener ingresos económicos. 
Luz se levanta desde tempranas horas de la mañana para organizar y limpiar su bodega, posteriormente se queda hasta las 8 ó 9 de la noche para lograr los ganancias necesarias y así cubrir los gastos de su familia; la cual es muy unida, apoyándose mutuamente para salir adelante.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y sus compañeras de grupo abogan mucho por ella, ya que le tienen mucha confianza porque la conocen del barrio donde viven. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos para implementar su tienda y así satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela.
texts.en:
Luz, 45, is a very hard-working woman who lives with her husband and three children, 18, 14, and 9 years of age, respectively, in her own home. For the past 10 years she has sold food items from a small grocery store she installed in her home. This business gives her the freedom to tend to her home and earn extra income at the same time. She rises very early every morning to organize and clean her store. Then, she minds it until 8 or nine at night in order to maximize her sales to better cover her household expenses. Her family is very unified and they support each other so that they all can get ahead in life. This is her first loan with MFP and her fellow group members are her greatest fans because they have a lot of trust in her and know her from the neighborhood they all live in. With the funds requested she will buy a greater quantity of stock products to shelve in her store so that she can meet the needs of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “30 D. Agosto”, vive en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 50 años D. edad, no cuenta con estudios, es viuda y tiene 5 hijos.
La señora Francisca tiene una tienda D. abarrotes y trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 10 años atrás y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra D. mercadería.
Ella solicitará un préstamo D. S/.1200.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà abarrotes como: fideos, arroz, azúcar, etc.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener una tienda D. abarrotes y comprarse un terreno.
Lo que màs le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the Communal Bank “30 D. Agosto.” She lives in the Ilave district of El Collao Province, Departament of Puno. She is 50 years old, doesn't have an education, is a widow and has 5 children. Francisca has a small grocery store and has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 10 years. Her first loan with her Communal Bank was for 300.00 new soles, which allowed her to purchase merchandise. She is requesting a loan of 1200.00 new soles to purchase groceries such as: noodles, rice, sugar etc. Her wish for the future is to have a grocery store and to buy herself a plot of land. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the savings and the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y su hija Rubí de 4 años de edad; todos ellos son muy unidos y viven en su casa propia.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y desde muy joven se ha dedicado al trabajo duro, es así que desde hace 5 años optó por la venta de pescado. María tiene un puesto en el mercado de su zona, empezando a atender desde tempranas horas de la mañana hasta las 3 ó 4 de la tarde, tiempo en el que termina de vender todos los pescados y mariscos. 
El negocio va muy bien y a ella le gusta mucho, pues le da tranquilidad; aunque no es nada fácil, ya que debe ser muy diestra para cortar los pescados.
Para el futuro, desea mejorar sus ingresos y así brindarle a su hija un futuro mejor, ya que ella es su principal motivo de vivir.

Este es el primer crédito de María con MFP, sus compañeras de grupo dicen que ella es muy responsable, por ello saben que no tendrá problemas con el pago de su préstamo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería en pescado para aumentar sus ventas y por ende tener mayores ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
María, 35, lives with her husband and her 4-year-old daughter, Rubí. They are a very tight family unit and live in their own home. She is a very hard-working woman and has worked very hard from a very young age. For the last five years she has been a fishwife. She has a stall in the local market where she starts her workday from very early in the morning until about 3 or 4 in the afternoon, which is about when she sells out her fish and seafood.
